loans.name: Withiakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 JUILLET 2002. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Ndike qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge six autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bouillie de mil, de patates et de beignets. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’augmenter son approvisionnement en mil et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Withiakh Group was created in solidarity on July 9, 2002. It consists of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Nidike who is on the left of the photo raising her hand is responsible for the group. She is 63 years old. She is a widow and mother to one child. She also takes care of six other children entrusted to her by her parents.

She actively sells mil [a type of cereal] gruel, potatoes and doughnuts. She is well experienced in this business domain, where she has been working for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her captial and to better develop her businesses.

The profits will allow her to increase her stock of mil and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy mil [a type of cereal], flour, and potatoes.

loans.name: Jappante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Siring qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bananes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…).
texts.en:
Jappante Group was formed in solidarity on July 9, 2002. It consists of 12 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Siring who is on the right of the photo raising her hand is responsible for the group. She is 46 years old. She is a widow and has no children. She takes care of five children entrusted to her by her parents.

She actively sells bananas. She is well experienced in this business, where she has been working for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and to better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (schooling etc.).

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Takk Ndingue Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mouskeba qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 63
 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same district. Their main activity is trading.

Mouskeba, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 63 years old and married with no children. She does, however, have four other children entrusted to her care by relatives.

She sells breakfasts and has good experience in this domain, as she has been doing this for several years. This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and develop her business more easily. The profits she makes will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Ilusión De Crecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Ilusión de Crecer” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, por mencionar algunos se encuentran la venta de ropa, preparación de comida típica del sur de Chile, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Castro.
Alejandra integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el tercer puesto de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo un buzo completo y zapatillas deportivas. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Sus productos los vende desde su propia casa y también los comercializa puerta a puerta, a sus conocidos y familiares. 
Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 3 meses, pero comenta que le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas, ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes y además está muy motivada de continuar, ya que comenta le brinda cierta independencia personal y con sus tiempos, ya que tiene la facilidad de flexibilizar sus horarios, para el cuidado de sus hijos. 
Su mercadería la compra al por mayor en el Barrio Meiggs, ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas para su negocio son instalar su negocio en un local establecido.
Alejandra vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, para participar, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Por otro lado el grupo del Banco comunal es muy ameno, comprometido y existe una muy buena comunicación entre los emprendedores del grupo. 
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los Lagos, zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ilusión de Crecer” and has 18 members who are in different lines of work among which we can mention clothing sales and preparation of traditional dishes from southern Chile, among others.  All of them are from the city of Castro.

Alejandra is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the front row third from right to left wearing a sweatshirt and athletic shoes.  She sells used and new clothes.  She sells her items from home and also door to door to acquaintances and family members.

She’s been in this occupation for three years but comments that she’s done very well with her sales because she has a good number of customers and she’s also very motivated to continue because she comments that it provides her with certain personal and time independence because she can be flexible with her schedules and look after her children.

She buys her merchandise at wholesale in the Meiggs neighborhood located in the city of Santiago.  The loan is to buy clothing to stock her business.  Her business goal is to set up her store in a fixed locale.

Alejandra lives with her husband and two children who are 8 and 2 years old.  Her dream is to prosper in her business to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has provided her to participate because she’s been able to invest in her business.  On the other hand, the group in the communal bank is very pleasant and committed and a good communication exists among the entrepreneurs in the group.

Castro is the capital of Chiloé Island (the largest island in South America), in the Los Lagos Region in the south of Chile.  Its natural surroundings are preserved with almost no human intervention.  It has a culture that’s rich in myth and legends.  One of its greatest attractions is the “palafitos” (houses) built on wooden stilts along the shore over the sea.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ndonguide Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on 9th July 2002 and is made up of twelve women who live in the same district. Their main activity is trading.

Mariama, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old, single and mother to two children. She also has four other children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives.

She sells vegetables and has good experience in this domain since she has been doing it for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and develop her business more easily. The profits she makes will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (schooling etc.)

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mougne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Mankagno qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bananes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This microcredit group was formed on the 9th July 2002. It is made up of twelve women who live in the same quarter. They sell various goods for a living. 

Madame Mankagno is on the right of the picture with her hand raised, and is the group leader. She is 54 years old and married with one child. She also had another five children entrusted to her care by her parents. 

She sells bananas for a living, and has been successful in this line of work as a result of several years' worth of experience. 

This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and better develop her business. Her profits would enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothes etc).

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 25 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja y tiene un hijo de 1 año, vive en casa de la madre de su conviviente y ahí educan a su hijo a quien desean dar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de comida y productos de belleza, todos los días desde muy temprano empieza su jornada cuando va al mercado y compra todos los ingredientes y e insumos necesarios para poder preparar los deliciosos y riquísimos pollos broaster, platillo que le gusta sus comensales, quienes van en busca de un buen servicio y una sazón exquisita. Además de trabajar en la venta de comida por las noches, también vende productos de belleza como cosméticos y de cuidado personal, esto lo hace durante el día y en su tiempo libre. Esta trabajando a este ritmo desde hace un año y se siente muy contenta, pues le gusta su trabajo, ya que ella decide que días y a que hora sale a vender o a ofrecer sus productos. Al tener dos actividades también significa que tiene doble ingresos a su economía y esto le permite tener mejores condiciones, pero no todo le fue siempre bien ya que al principio le fue muy complicado por que no sabia mucho el negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando y ahora es muy buena en lo que hace. Ahora esta preparándose para ampliar sus actividades y empezar a vender zapatos y ropa. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, esta a la expectativa de que le brinden un apoyo para así poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y cumplir con sus metas, por otro lado se compromete en ser una cliente puntual ya que tiene muy buenas referencias del grupo al que se esta incorporando por que son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará zapatos y ropa para empezar a vender ya que esta por incursionar en este negocio, además de ingrediente e insumos no perecibles y tener para seguir trabajando con su venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lucia, 25, is a good, kind woman.  She has a spouse and a one-year-old son.  She lives in her spouse’s mother’s house and they educate their son there and wish for a better quality of life for him.

Lucia’s work consists in selling food and beauty products.  She begins her day very early going to the market to buy all the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare her delicious Broaster-style chicken, a favorite of her diners, who come by seeking good service and exquisite taste.  Besides selling food in the evening she also sells cosmetics and personal care products during the day and in her free time.  She’s been working at this pace for a year and feels very happy because she likes her work because she says that she decides what days and what work schedule she’ll use to go out and sell her products.  Having two jobs also means double income and this provides better conditions.  But it wasn’t always like this.  At the beginning it was quite complicated because she didn’t know much about the business.  However, in time she improved and now she is very good at what she does.  At present, she’s getting ready to expand activities and start to sell shoes and clothes.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She is hopeful that she’ll get the support to continue doing her work and reach her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to be a punctual client because she has very good references of the group she’s joining because they are very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy shoes and clothes to start to sell because she’s about to start out in this business.  She will also buy ingredients and non-perishable supplies to continue working preparing food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients and also to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 38 years old and is married with 4 children.

Elisapeta owns and operates a transportation business venture (taxi service).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Elisapeta needs a loan of WST $1500 to renew her vehicle license and to repaint her vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 560 talas or US $233 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Elisapeta's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to renew her vehicle license and to repaint her vehicle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica nacida en el municipio del torno, la Sra. Verónica esta  separada de su pareja, vive en la localidad de San Luis, ella tiene 1 hijo de 5 años que según la señora Verónica es su razón de  superarse día a día. La Sra. Verónica se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza a domicilio y ambulando por distintos lugares visita también oficinas. El destino del crédito es para la ampliar el negocio comprando mercaderías por mayor de sus productos de belleza. Por lo tanto ella esta agradecida con la institución por su primer préstamo, ya que le esta dando una oportunidad de iniciar y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Verónica was born in the municipality of El Torno.  She’s separated from her spouse and living in San Luis.  She has a five-year-old son who according to Verónica is her reason for being better every day.  Verónica sells beauty products door to door and also wandering through various places; she also visits offices.  The loan is to expand the business buying beauty product merchandise at wholesale.  She is grateful to the institution for this, her first loan, because it’s giving her an opportunity to start out and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es: El señor Luis a sus 38 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 7 años, se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de aseo tales como clorox, aromatizantes, jabones, escobas y traperos, con esta actividad lleva 10 años gracias a un amigo quien le enseño la formulación para fabricar estos productos. El señor Luis requiere de la compra materia prima y material de empaque que le faciliten y le permitan elaboran un mayor numero de producto terminado y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle lo  mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Luis is 38 years old and the father of a 7-year-old son. He makes and sells cleaning products such as laundry bleach, home fragrances, soap, brooms and mops. He has been in this business for 10 years, thanks to a friend who taught him the formulas to make these products. Luis needs to purchase supplies and packaging material which will make it easier for him to make a higher volume of finished product. That way he can meet his customers' orders, improve his living conditions and provide the best for his son.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make detergent, home fragrances, brooms and mops.

loans.name: Aolele

texts.en:
Aolele is 56 years old and is married with 5 children.
Aolele owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting peanuts for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Aolele needs a loan of WST $1200 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Aolele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aolele's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 54 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive a lado de su conviviente en una casa propia que pudieron comprar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Martha consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano se va al mercado en busca de los ingredientes mas frescos e insumos mas selectos para así brindar un buen producto a sus clientes, una vez en su casa prepara y sale a vender a sus clientes quienes le son muy fieles ya que saben que sus sazón es buena y tiene una trato único con ellos. Todo este trabajo lo hace en su casa y esta muy contenta de haber podido superar sus miedos y dudas que tenía antes de empezar con su trabajo. Le gusta lo que hace pues le permite disponer de su tiempo además de colocar otros productos como el de gaseosas y hielo que le permiten tener un ingreso adicional a su economía. Le esta yendo bien y tiene como planes a futuro el de poder poner un restaurante en su casa, pero sabe que es un proceso que será un poco largo así que por ahora solo quiere seguir consolidándose y aumentar de a poco la variedad de platos que brinda a sus clientes. Este será el segundo préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo. Sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, esta contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platos, además de bebidas para continuar con su venta.
texts.en:
Martha, who is 54, is a friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives with her domestic partner with whom she has two older and independent children.  She and her partner live together in a house they were able to buy through hard work and sacrifice.  

Martha sells prepared foods.  She rises very early to go to the market and look for the freshest ingredients and best supplies to be able to provide a good product to her clients.  Once at home, she prepares food and then goes out to sell to her customers, who are very loyal.  They know her food has good flavor, and Martha has a unique relationship with them.  

All of this work is done from the home, and Martha is happy to have overcome the fears and doubts she had before she began working. She likes what she does because it allows her to use her time effectively and earn additional income through sales of other products like soda and ice. She is doing well and has future plans to establish a restaurant in her home, but she knows it is a lengthy process.  For now, she just wants to continue to improve and increase little by little the variety of dishes offered to her customers. 

This is Martha's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very happy to receive financial support through which she can increase working capital. She knows she will have to be very responsible and above all punctual.  She is glad to be a member of her communal bank, whose members are very supportive. With the requested loan of $575 (1500 soles), she will buy ingredients to prepare her delicious meals.  She will also continue to purchase beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for food preparation as well as drinks.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 34 year old mother with a high school education. For some time Iman has been unemployed and decided, with training and assistance, to open her own business. She learned to sew and has begun to assist family and friends with seamstress service. Now as she wants to provide better for herself and her child she has turned her skill into a business activity to increase her household's monthly income. 

Iman needed this loan to purchase cloth and a sewing machine. The loan is assisting her in developing her business and increasing her earnings. 

Iman wants in the future to improve her design skills. She wants one day to sell her own dress designs and products.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fouimalo

texts.en:
Fouimalo is 36 years old and is married with 3 children.
Fouimalo owns and operates a transportation business venture (taxi service).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Fouimalo needs a loan of WST $1000 to maintain her vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Fouimalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fouimalo's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to repaint her vehicle

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: El señor Hernando a sus 52 años de edad se dedica a la producción agrícola de zanahorias, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre desde hace 25 años, el producto cosechado es vendido en la plaza del pueblo de Sonsón localizado al oriente de Antioquia. El señor Hernando necesita de la compra de abonos, riegos y semillas que le permitan mejorar su cultivo puesto que el invierno le ha desmejorado considerablemente la producción. El señor Hernando espera mejorar sus ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernando is a 52-year-old farmer who grows carrots. He learned this activity from his father 25 years ago. His products are sold in the town square of Sonsón, which is located west of Antioquia.

Sr. Hernando needs to pay for compost, irrigation, and seeds so that he can improve his crop. Winter has brought about a considerable decrease in production. Sr. Hernando expects to improve his income and provide a better quality of life for his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for compost, irrigation, and seeds.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 54-year-old mother of three living in Dimona. She is determined to break out of her current economic situation and move off of welfare. Now that her children are grown, Jennifer has decided to expand a small business activity she has had for years. Jennifer makes health bars and sells them in her own community. This activity has garnered a small profit for her each month but now she has the opportunity to expand and begin sales throughout the region and into other areas of the country. 

Jennifer needs this loan to buy materials and supplies for expansion. 

Jennifer wants to see her business activity grow into a secure monthly income and expand her customer base into stores and locations throughout Israel.

loans.use: Jennifer needs this loan to buy materials and supplies for expansion.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 49 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 20, 12 y 3 años, ellos son su razón de mucho trabajo y sacrificio. Vive en su casa propia en donde comparte la alegría de criar a sus hijos a lado de su pareja a quien le brinda las comodidades que puede. El trabajo de Rolando, consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, se encarga de comprar en cantidades y los vende al menudeo, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en una calle muy concurrida y con mucho potenciales clientes. Además de trabajar en su bodega, también se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y alcohólicas a personas mayores de edad, lleva realizando este trabajo por ya 8 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su conviviente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite generar ingresos desde la comodidad de su hogar, además de poder trabajar a lado de sus conviviente. Espera poder seguir consolidándose con su trabajo y aumentar con sus productos ya que le falta algunas cosas necesarias para su venta. Le gustaría más adelante poner un minimarket y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta muy emocionado que una entidad le este dando la confianza de poder invertir mas su capital de trabajo y así poder crecer económicamente, agradece mucho por lo que le brindaran y promete no defraudar y ser responsable y puntual en sus cuotas, esta contento trabajar con su banco comunal ya que son muy exigentes con su puntualidad. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos para su bodega, bebidas, lácteos, arroz, azúcar y otros mas para así ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rolando, 49, is a very hard-working, honest and responsible man.  He lives with his common-law wife and three children, ages 20, 12 and 3, who are the reason for so much work and sacrifice.  He lives in his own house where he shares with his wife the joys of raising children and trying to give them as many comforts as possible.  Rolando has a small retail grocery business in his house which is on a busy street with many potential customers.  He also works selling sodas and alcoholic beverages to adults, which he has done for eight years with his wife's help.

What he enjoys about his work is that he can generate an income from the comfort of his own home while also working alongside his wife.  He hopes to consolidate his business and add the products he needs to have on hand.  In the future he would like to establish a minimarket and offer a wider variety of items to customers.

This is his third loan through MFP and he is very excited about the fact that an organization is placing confidence in him so he can increase his working capital and grow economically.  He is very grateful for the support and promises not to disappoint anyone and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He is happy working with his communal bank because they are very adamant about punctuality.  He plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy products for his store such as beverages, dairy products, rice, sugar and other items to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.use: To buy beverages, dairy products, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Amina es clienta de EDAPROSPO por varios años, ella pertenece al grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS”  lo conforman 09 socias y Amina es una de ellas, sus 2 hijos aun están en edad escolar el negocio que tiene es la venta de diversos productos, ella empezó vendiendo artículos pequeños como zapatillas, ropas y accesorios de belleza, durante todo este tiempo los pedidos fueron en aumento  por la facilidad de pago que les brinda a sus clientes, es así que actualmente puede comprar y vender productos más grandes como bicicletas y algunos artefactos. Vender estos productos a crédito le otorgan mayores ganancias sus clientes son en su mayoría comerciantes que tienen sus propios negocios, gracias a su trabajo puede pagar la universidad de uno de sus hijos y lograr que sea un profesional será su mayor logro, el préstamo de EDAPROSPO le será de gran utilidad para comprar articulos navideños especialmente juguetes debido a la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas será un buen negocio, por otro lado está a punto de comprar un terreno donde construirá su casa y pondrá una tienda para seguir trabajando.

•	La Sra. Amina es la octava viste polo rojo y cartera negra, también aparece una señora como invitada.
texts.en:
Amina has been a client of EDAPROSPO for several years. She is a member of the group “Madres Ladereñas” which consists of nine members. Amina is one of them. Her two children are in school.

Amina has a business selling different products. She began selling small items such as slippers, clothing, and beauty accessories. Throughout the entire she has been in business, her orders have increased because of the payment options she offers to her customers. The products she buys and sells the most are bicycles and a few appliances. Amina sells these products on credit so that she can obtain more profit. Most of her customers are merchants who have their own business. Thanks to her work, Amina is able to pay for the university education of one of her children. Seeing her children become professionals will be her greatest achievement. The loan from EDAPROSPO will be a great help with purchasing goods for the holiday season, especially toys for the approaching Christmas parties. This will turn out to be a good business. At some point, Amina would like to buy a piece of land on which she can build her house and set up a store so that she can continue working.

Sra. Amina is the eighth woman, wearing a red polo shirt and holding a black handbag. Also appearing in the photo is another woman who is a guest.

loans.use: to purchase toys and other Christmas goods.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 30 años, es una mujer amable, solidaria y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 11 y 2 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus hijos, ella trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de comida, jugos y desayunos, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a vender sus jugos en la vereda de su casa y por las tardes arma su mesita y pone su asador y comienza con la preparación de sus exquisitos potajes, entre las cosas que vende encontramos Juanes, asados de todo tipo, tacacho y mas platos exquisitos con su toque de sazón y secreto de cocina, lleva realizando su trabajo recién por un año, además de trabajar en esta actividad, ella trabaja en una entidad del estado y tiene como un ingreso adicional el de este trabajo, lo hace sola y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene dos ingresos y eso le permite brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Como toda mujer con ganas de superarse tiene muchos objetivo, pero el principal por ahora es el de consolidarse con sus actividades y así mejorar la infraestructura de su casa en donde realiza su trabajo. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes con personas responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y materiales para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is a very kind, supportive and responsible woman who lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 11 and 2, in their own house.  She works hard to give her family a better quality of life.  Rosa has a business selling food, juices and breakfasts.  She gets up early every day to begin selling her juices on the porch of her house and in the afternoons she sets up a table and barbecue and starts making her exquisit stews, "Juanes" (Peruvian tamales), tacacho (mashed plantain dish), and other dishes that have her special touch and cooking secrets.  She has been in business for a year.  She also works for a government agency, so her own business is extra income, allowing her to give her children a better lifestyle.

Like all women who want to get ahead, Rosa has many goals but the main one is to consolidate her activities and improve her home's infrastructure, as this is where she works.  This is her fourth loan through MFP.  She is content knowing she can count on this financial support which gives her more confidence for advancing in her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and supportive.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy ingredients and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make juice and breakfasts, as well as plates.

loans.name: Azul Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUL AZUL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, venta de papa, artesanía, tejido de mantas

La señora Elena,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá a domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Azul Azul” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes community center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors led by Sra. Elena. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses to get ahead such as selling fruit, selling potatoes, handicrafts, and weaving blankets.

Sra. Elena says that she is working with Pro Mujer for the first time. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a promoter. Elena currently has a business making woven blankets and has been working for several years. She learned this trade from her mother.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital to buy wool, which she acquires in bulk at the fairs. Upon making her products, Elena sells them from her home. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elena said that she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Leausa

texts.en:
Leausa is 28 years old and is married with 2 children.
Leausa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  Leausa needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to supplement her family's income.

Leausa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leausa's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi is 28 years old and is married with 4 children.
Lagi owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lagi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 145 talas or US $60 per week) to supplement her family's income and improve her business status.

Lagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lagi's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Yuuliana vive en el distrito de los Olivos, tiene una familia grande sus 4 hijos aun están en edad escolar, junto a su esposo luchan para sacar adelante a su familia, es así que  ahorrando algo de dinero  han podido comprar un carro que alquilan para realizar servicio de taxi, el ingreso que le genera el alquiler de su carro es de mucha ayuda  así puede brindarle a su hijos una buena educación y comprar algunos artículos para su hogar, el préstamo que le otorga EDAPROSPO le será de mucha ayuda para la reparación y mantenimiento del carro, de esa manera podrá seguir alquilándolo, Yuuliana es la tesorera del grupo “CORAZON DE JESUS” ya tiene cerca de 2 años integrando el ALCOM, ella quiere seguir ahorrando para lograr comprarse otro vehículo.

*Yuuliana viste polo fuccia.
texts.en:
Yuuliana lives in the District of Los Olivos. She has a large family that includes four school-age children. She and her husband strive together to move their family forward. After saving some money, she was able to buy a car to rent out for taxi services. The income generated from renting out her car has been a great help because it has provided her children with a good education. Yuuliana was also able to buy a few items for her home.

The loan being provided by EDAPROSPO will be a great help in repairing and maintaining her vehicle so that it can continue to be available for rent. Yuuliana is the treasurer of the group “Corazon de Jesus” (Heart of Jesus) and has been a member of the Communal Bank for nearly two years. She wants to continue saving so that she can purchase another vehicle.

*Yuuliana is seen wearing a fuchsia-colored polo shirt.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and repairs to her taxi.

loans.name: Rose

texts.es: Rose, de 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, esta separada, pero vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 04 años. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres, su hermana y sus sobrinos. El trabajo de Rose consiste en la venta de cerveza, todos los lunes realiza su pedido a las distribuidoras con las que trabaja, pone a helar y vende a sus clientes que siempre van a su casa en busca de una cerveza muy helada. Ella es muy responsables y es por eso que solo vende a personas mayores de edad y con acreditación de mayoría en mano, además de vencer bebidas alcohólicas también vende gaseosas, hielo y chupetes de frutas regionales. Aún recuerda el primer día que se puso a vender y todos los temores y dudas que tenía, pero de a poco fue consolidándose y aprendiendo el negocio, ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes. Su plan es montar una fuente de soda y empezar mas adelante a ser distribuidora, pero por el momento solo quiere consolidarse y crecer de a poco. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir siendo una socia puntual como en el crédito anterior que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más bebidas alcohólicas, además de gaseosas e ingrediente y mas insumos para seguir preparando sus chupetes.
texts.en:
Rose, 34, is a good, kind, hard-working woman who is divorced.  She lives with her two children, ages 17 and 4, in her parents' home where her sister and nieces and nephews also live.  Rose sells beer, and every Monday she places an order through the distributors she works with.  She keeps the beer on ice so that customers can come to her house any time and get cold beer.  She is very responsible and only sells to adults who bring their I.D.  In addition to alcoholic beverages she also sells sodas, ice and popsicles made with regional fruit.  

She still remembers the first day she started selling, and all the fear and doubts she had, but little by little she learned about the business and was able to consolidate it, and now she is a great saleslady and has many customers.  Her goal is to establish a soda fountain and in the future become a distributor.  But for now she wants to focus on her business and continue growing gradually.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is counting on you to help her reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and continue being a punctual member as with previous loans.  She plans to use the 1,500 PEN loan to buy alcoholic beverages, sodas and ingredients and supplies to make popsicles.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, and fruit to make popsicles.

loans.name: Mata

texts.en:
Mata is 28 years old and a single woman.

Mata owns & operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Mata needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 180 talas or US $75 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Mata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mata's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS” iniciará su decimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nancy. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cerveza, negocio de frazadas, artesanías en bolsitas, compra y venta de objetos, venta de abarrotes, macramé de mantas, elaboración de lienzos y sogas venta de batidos, venta de dulces.

La señora Nancy,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de amigos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de artículos para el hogar que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de objetos para el hogar) que comprará la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la seguridad y el personal.

En la fotografía no esta la señora Beatriz, ya que por motivos culturales no quizo ser retratada.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Margaritas” is starting its 13th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Nancy. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling beer, producing blankets, producing handcrafted bags, buying and selling goods, selling groceries, producing macramé shawls, producing linens and rope, selling milkshakes, and selling candy.

Sra. Nancy says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from her friends. Nancy currently has a business selling household goods in which she has worked for many years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing household goods, which she will acquire in La Ceja and then sell at her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. She has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nancy said that she enjoys the security and the staff.

Sra. Beatriz is not present. Due to cultural reasons, she did not want to have her photograph taken.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 56 años, es una amable señora, muy responsable y trabajadora, esta separada del que fue su conviviente por muchos y con quien tuvo cinco hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive a lado de una de sus hojas en su casa propia, desde donde trabaja mucho para poder tener buenas condiciones de vida. El trabajo de Teresa consiste en la venta de bebidas, entre los productos que tiene, ofrece gaseosas de todas las marcas, presentaciones y tamaños, además de vender bebidas alcohólicas pero solo a personas mayores de edad ya que le es conciente de las leyes y la protección que se tiene que tener con los jóvenes, lleva realizando este trabajo por 25 años y le permitió dar educación y alimentar a sus hijos. Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace ya que vende mucho y como lleva años realizando esta actividad y tiene muy buenos clientes, al principio le fue complicado ya que en aquellos tiempo tenía la dificultad del fluido eléctrico y el costo muy elevado de tener una refrigeradora. Todo lo solucionó y lo superó y ahora esta yendo todo bien y con planes de seguir creciendo. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas asegura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte se compromete una vez mas a seguir siendo una socia cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas, esta muy contenta de trabajar junto a los de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy solidarios y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará bebidas en mayor cantidad y así poder ofrecer todo tipo de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa, 56, is a very kind, responsible, hard-working woman who has been divorced from her common-law husband for several years.  She has five children by him who are all adults and independent.  She lives next door to one of her daughters, in her own house, where whe works hard to lead a comfortable life.  Teresa sells beverages, including all brands, formats and sizes of sodas, and alcohol to adults, being very careful not to sell to minors in observance of the law.  She has been in business for 25 years and it has enabled her to educate and feed her chidlren.

Things are going very well for her since she has a high sales volume and many customers.  It was complicated at first because there was difficulty having access to electricity and running a refrigerator was costly.  But all of the obstacles have been overcome and now things are going fine with plans for growth.  This is her third loan through MFP and she is happy to count on this financial support which will give her confidence to advance in her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and continue being a member who pays punctually.  She enjoys her communal bank because all the members are very supportive and responsible.  She plans to use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy more beverages and have a variety of products to offer customers.

loans.use: To buy more beverages, including beer and sodas.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 40 years old and is married with 4 children.

Fatima owns & operates a business venture, selling both food & daily-use products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Fatima needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Fatima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fatima's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional food and daily-use products to sell

loans.name: Lenin Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Lenin , es habitante del municipio de Ticuatepe , junto su familia , con el primer financiamiento logro mejorar el piso de la vivienda , los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que el labora para un empresa privada y su salario no le ajusta para comprar de una sola todos los materiales necesarios para realizar un anexo en la parte trasera de vivienda .Lenin se siente muy contento con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician con estos programas de mejorar de vivienda para personas de bajos recursos .
texts.en:
Sr. Lenin is a resident of the town of Ticuatepe, where he lives with his family. With his first loan, he was able to make improvements to the floor of his home. His plans for the future include improving his living conditions. Lenin works for a private company, but his salary is not adjusted so that he can make a one-time purchase for all of the necessary materials to build an annex at the back of his house.

He is very pleased with the support AFODENIC has provided through the Kiva funds. There are many families who benefit from these programs in which low-income people can improve their homes.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building an annex at the back of his house.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes a futuros es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Isabel cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que trabaja en una empresa privada y esto le permite que los gastos de dividan en el hogar , doña Isabel  lleva muchos años laborando como comérciate y a la vez para una empresa privada , ellos dos se esfuerzan mucho para poder construir su vivienda , pero todavía no les ajusta para comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción y asi cumplir sus sueños de tener un techo digno y gozar de privacidad . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de Kiva ya que sin ellos no fuese posible construir sueños y hacerlo realidad .
texts.en:
Señora Isabel lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her family.  Her plans for the future are to be able to improve her living conditions.  

Doña Isabel has the support of her husband, as he works in a private enterprise and this allows them to divide the household expenses between them.  Doña Isabel has spent several years working as a business-woman and sometimes for a private company.  They are both struggling greatly to build their home, but they still have not been able to make a one-time purchase of construction materials and so accomplish their dreams of having a decent roof and a source of privacy.

She is grateful for the support being provided by Afodenic through Kiva, as without this, it would not be possible to build their dreams and make them into reality.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Don Oscar es Habitante del municipio de San caralampio , junto a su familia , don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de Piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo y no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para combatir  dicha plaga , ya que los siembras también ah sufrido daño por la naturaleza , asi como las inundaciones ya que parte del cultivo se vino abajo .Don Oscar se siente desesperado ya que si no aplica fertilizantes e insumos a su cultivo podría ser una pérdida total . Agradece al apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva ; ya que le dan la confianza a pequeños agricultores para que puedan salir adelante con la producción y asi mejorar sus ingresos para darle un mejor apoyo económico a su familia .
texts.en:
Don Oscar lives in the town of San Caralampio with his family.  

Don Oscar has been working growing pineapples for several years.  The biggest challenge he faces are the pests that invade the crop, and he doesn't have the financial resources necessary to combat such an infestation as the crops have also suffered damage from nature; part of his crops had already collapsed from flooding.

Don Oscar is feeling desperate, as if he doesn't apply fertilizers and other supplies to his crops, he could lose them altogether.

He is grateful for the support being offered by Afodenic through the Kiva foundation, as they are placing their trust in small farmers so that they can move ahead with their production and in this way improve their income to provide better financial support for their families.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Jackeline, es habitante del municipio de San Ignacio, junto  a su familia, doña Jackeline desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de frutas, verduras y queso, la mayor afectación que se  presento  es el alza de los productos debido a las grandes inundaciones por la cual paso el país en tiempos de invierno, casi todos los cultivos de frutas se perdieron, ahora ella quiere aprovechar la temporada de Navidad para mejorar su ventas y sus ingresos. Ella está muy agradecida  con Kiva ya que a pesar que tuvo problemas en dar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma siempre le siguen apoyando para mejorar su inventario en su negocio y asi tener capital disponible para seguir invirtiendo el resto del año .
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her family, in the municipality of San Ignacio.  She has sold fruits, vegetables and cheese for several years. 

The greatest challenge that has arisen is the increase in product prices, due to the major winter flooding that the country experienced. Almost all the fruit crops were lost. Now she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to improve her sales and income. 

She is very thankful to Kiva, as despite the fact she had problems making her payments in a timely manner, they are continuing to help her improve the inventory of her business, so that she has working capital at her disposal, to continue investing during the rest of the year.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ria Kareen

texts.en:
Ria Kareen is from the Catadman, Catadman, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Ria Kareen is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Ria Kareen owns and operates a small restaurant.  Rebie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Ria Kareen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for additional ingredients to cook and sell.

In 2011, Ria Kareen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional food to cook and to sell

loans.name: Jay Dawn

texts.en:
Jay Dawn is single. Jay Dawn is 27 years old, residing at Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Jay Dawn own and operates a coco farm land, planting & harvesting coconut for sale to earn a living.She has been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,500 doing this type of business. Jay dawn is very proficient in handling the business she operates by that the revenue generated is of high-quality. 

She requested a loan of 20,000.00 to purchase coconut fertilizer for the good growth of coconut. Jay Dawn is been a member of GDMPC for 5 year. In the future, plans that the business she handle will grow and progress.

loans.use: To purchase coconut fertilizer for the good growth of coconut

loans.name: Touk's Group

texts.en:
Touk is 29 years old, married and has only son studying in a primary school. He lives in a rural area located in the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is common. He has earned a living as a peasant who grows red maize on his farmland for ten years and he supplements his income by working as a worker. 

This is Touk’s first group loan with VisionFund. Now requesting for a loan, he will use this loan to hire workers to harvest his maize crops. He hopes to make more maize to better support his family and also keep his son in school.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest his maize crops

loans.name: Moet's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ratanak Mondul district, Moet is 53 years old and has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She started growing maize ten years ago to make a living in the village. 

Moet and her three group members in the picture are applying for their first loan with VisionFund. Moet will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her maize crops. She hopes to make more maize and generate more income to make her living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her maize crops.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary is a 49-year-old peasant who has been growing maize for more than ten years to earn a living and feed her big family. She lives in a village of the Ratanak Mondul district with her seven children, five of whom are still in school. 

Sary now leads a group of three members applying for their first loan with VisionFund. She is the only lady in the group. She wants to hire workers to harvest her maize crops. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crops and increase her income to better feed her family and also keep her children in school until graduation. In addition, she hopes to have some savings for the future.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her maize crops

loans.name: Saitua

texts.en:
Saitua is 40 years old and is married with 6 children.

Saitua owns & operates a transportation business venture (taxi service).  She has one year of experience in this business.  Saitua needs a loan of WST $1500 to maintain the vehicle.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Saitua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Saitua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to repaint a vehicle

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es: El señor Jose,  es un pequeño agricultor de zona de Ticuantepe, durante mucho tiempo sea dedicado al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación que se le presento fue las inundación en el cultivo ya que perdido todos los hijos de piña que pensaba renovar, pero no fue asi , ya que con el primer crédito logro establecer un cuarto de manzana de piña , el cual lo perdió, ahora el necesita volver a sembrar pero no cuenta con el capital para la compra de un mil hijos de piña , fertilizantes e insumos que requiere la plantación para salvar lo poco que quedo. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ; ya que sin este programa de ayuda para los agricultores no sería posible recuperar la plantación de piña .
texts.en:
Señor Jose is a small-scale farmer from the Ticuantepe area.  He has been working growing pineapples for a long time. 

The biggest challenge that he has faced was the flooding of his crops, as he lost all the pineapple plants which he had thought to grow, but he wasn't able to.  With his first loan he managed to establish an area for growing pineapple, which he lost.  Now he needs to plant once again, but he doesn't have the capital for purchasing 1,000 pineapple plants and fertilizers and the supplies that the plantation requires in order to salvage the little that remains.

He is grateful for the support that is being provided by Afodenic through the Kiva funds, as without this assistance program for farmers, it would not be possible to recover his pineapple plantation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Faalili

texts.en:
Faalili is 37-years-old and is married with 5 children.

Faalili owns & operates a business venture, selling breadfruit products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Faalili needs a loan of WST $1200 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to help with her children`s education.

Faalili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faalili's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Teresa, es una humilde agricultora del zona de Ticuantepe, ella habita junto a su familia, durante muchos años se dedica al cultivo de piña, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el financiamiento anterior logro darle mantenimiento a una manzana de Piña , ahora ella quiere establecer  media manzana mas , pero no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar la inversión , ya que si logrará establecerlo mejoraría sus condiciones de vida , ya que la agricultura es su gran fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva para lograr sus planes hacia su cultivo.
texts.en: Teresa is a humble farmer from the area of Ticuantepe.  She lives with her family.  She has grown pineapples for a living for many years.  Her plans for her family are to improve their living conditions.  With her previous loan she was able to maintain a field of pineapple; now she wants to plant half a field more, but she doesn't have the capital to make the investment.  If she is able to set this up, it will improve her living conditions since agriculture is her main source of income for supporting her family.  She is thankful for the help she has received from AFODENIC through Kiva to achieve her goals for her  crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Mrs. Chhen is a 31-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of 3 school-aged children and she is in the business of cultivating rice. She has been engaged in this business, from which she is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day, for 6 years. In the past few weeks, some of her windows were broken and are no longer usable. Chhen wants to replace the broken ones by using this loan. It’s going to cost around KHR1,500,000. She is very happy and thankful for the loan she will receive because it will provide a comfortable living for the whole family.

loans.use: to replace broken windows.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en: Rithy, 35, is single and resides with his parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a policeman and security guard at KREDIT office in Kampong Chhnang Province. Rithy is requesting a loan of USD 700 to pay for his wedding ceremony. In the future, he would like to run a grocery store for his future wife to generate more income to support the family and renew his house.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding ceremony.

loans.name: Cherry Jane

texts.en:
At age 22, Cherry Jane got married to Jorge. They have two children now and their family is less well off. The couple had to increase their income so that they can afford to send thier children up to college level of education and someday earn a degree. This is Cherry Jane's goal in life. 

Cherry Jane vends fruits and vegetables at the public market of Centro Southeast. Cherry Jane is now asking for a loan in order to buy onions, garlic, cabbages, and potatoes to sell. She wants to stock more fruits and vegetables. She is asking for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This will help make her business more profitable, and increase her earnings too.

loans.use: To buy onions, garlic, cabbages, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married and has 11 children. She resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Vilma operates a fishing business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns 3,000 per month.

She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Vilma is been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Vilma wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nelly Rafaela

texts.es: Doña Nelly, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto con su familia. Con el crédito anterior, doña Nelly a logrado establecer una red de vendedores permitiéndole obtener mayores rendimiento en las ventas, logrando de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ;  con este crédito que ahora le brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondo Kiva, lograra  ampliar la oferta de  productos naturales, pudiendo asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en cuanto a nuevos productos   .
texts.en: Nelly lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family.  With her previous loan, Nelly was able to set up a network of salespeople, which allowed her to get a higher yield from sales.  This has allowed her to improve her family's quality of life.  With the loan AFODENIC is currently offering her through Kiva's funding, she will be able to expand on the natural products she offers, thus allowing her to satisfy her customers' demands for new products.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman with two children. Elizabeth is 31 years old, residing in the Philippines. Elizabeth owns and operates farm land, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Elizabeth has been a member of GDMPC for 6 years. In the future, Elizabeth wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Jocelyn is married. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.


In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es: La señora Ada , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto con su familia , ella desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapato de segunda , la mayor afectación  que se le presenta es su embarazo ya que esta actividad de vendedor es muy agitada lo cual le ha ocasionado dolores muy fuertes  en su columna , pero ella sigue adelante sobre esforzándose para darle una mejor condición de vida , ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva . El préstamo lo quiere para invertir en una paca de ropa y zapatos usados para aprovechar la temporada y asi obtener un mejor ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Ada lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her family.

For the last several years, she has worked selling clothing and second-hand shoes.  The biggest challenging facing her is her pregnancy, as selling is a very busy activity which has caused her severe pain in her spine.  However, she continues forward in her efforts to provide better living conditions.

She is very happy with the support being offered by Afodenic through the Kiva fund.  She wants to invest the loan in a pack of clothing and used shoes, so as to take advantage of the season and so earn a better income.

loans.use: purchasing clothing and shoes.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On is 28 years old and a loving mother of four children. She is a local farmer, cultivating annual rice crops throughout the year. She also takes some time to sell sweet things, snacks, and groceries for extra profit. 

After the rice season ends, Mrs. On will have available time to do work at home, so she wants to improve her living condition by raising some piglets in her backyard. Now she would like to borrow some funds to build a wooden piggery and buy some piglets and feeds. She hopes that she will be able to lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: To build a wooden piggery and buy some piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of the business. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: Maria Luisa is a married woman having one child. Maria Luisa is 47 years old, residing in Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Maria Luisa owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 4,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer. Maria Luisa has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Maria Luisa wants to make improvements of her house and to support the completion of her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of eastern Mongolia. Her husband and elder child are employed. Her younger child is a college student. 

Enhtuya operates a grocery retail business. She started her grocery retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. Now that the holiday season is approaching, she needs 500,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to buy more fruit at wholesale prices in order to meet her customers' demand. Her current supplies are not quite enough to run her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Krinh

texts.en: Mrs. Krinh, a 71-year-old married mother of 8 children from Pouk district, is a very hardworking farmer who grows rice crops in the rainy season of the year. She also takes some time besides farming to weave and sell her bamboo baskets at home. Through those businesses, she can generate a profit of $2.50 per day. Krinh is asking for a loan in the sum of $1,000 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her two sons, who currently work as construction workers place-to-place around Siem Reap province. For her prospect, she wishes to own a store in the province to sell her bamboo basket products by herself.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her sons.

loans.name: Paepaepuna

texts.en:
Paepaepuna is 18 years of age and is single. She is engaged in a sewing business, providing general clothing services to local community members.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Paepaepuna needs a loan of 1500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Paepaepuna joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Paepaepuna's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who has one child. Elma is 28 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 7,080 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Elma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Elma wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Bernarda Lila

texts.es: La señora Bernarda, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, ella es muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atravez de los fondos Kiva , ya que con el primer préstamo logro mejorar el techo de su humilde vivienda, ahora sus planes es poder realizar una caseta donde esta ubicado el lavandero y los barriles de agua , por q el actual está muy deteriorado y en  tiempos de lluvia no puede realizar la actividades de aseo en su casa porque toda la lluvia le cae .  Ya que ella no cuanta con los recursos económicos para poder realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de necesita para dicha obra, como bloques, cemento, arena, perlines, entre otros.
texts.en: Bernarda lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family.  She is very happy with the help she has received from AFODENIC through Kiva's funding since with her first loan she managed to improve the roof of her humble home. Her current plan is to rebuild a shed for the laundry machine and to store water barrels. In its current state, the shed is very deteriorated and when it rains she can't do her chores because water is everywhere. She doesn't have the economic resources to buy the materials necessary for the project, such as cinderblock, cement, sand, beams, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Galo is 28 years old and is married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.

Galo needs a loan of 1500 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Galo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Galo's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan is 31 years old, a resident who has been living Baray district, Cambodia. She is married with two children who are attending school. Presently Mrs. Chan owns 3 hectares of farmland for growing rice, potatoes, and vegetable crops. Today her farmland is available again after the rice season has just ended. Mrs. Chan will start growing her potato crops next. However, due to lack of her capital, Mrs. Chan won’t be able to start this project. So now she acquires this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy her crop seeds, fertilizers, and other basic materials for her project. She is very grateful for the support of her business. She hopes that she will be able to upgrade her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To buy crop seeds, fertilizers, and other basic materials for her project.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman having three children. Jenifer is 33 years old, residing at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines. 

Jenifer is starting a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Jenifer has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jenifer wants to make improvements to her business venture.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 22 years old and single. She owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or $167 USD per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family and to upgrade her business status.

Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lupe's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Karla  Patricia
