texts.es: La señora Karla , es  una humilde agricultora de piña de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que a pesar de su condiciones económicas está apoyando a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela , doña Karla cuenta con una manzana establecida de piña , pero esta carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una buena producción y asi venderla a un mejor precio ; para que sus ganancias seas factibles y asi diversificar sus cultivos .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda KIVA a las mujeres agricultoras de las zonas rurales de Nicaragua para dar ejemplo que a pesar de la situación que enfrenta el país si se puede salir adelante .
texts.en:
Karla farms pineapple on a small scale, with her family in the Ticuantepe area.  Her plan for the future is to improve her living conditions, as despite her financial situation, she is supporting her children, so that they can go to school.  

Karla has one hectare planted in pineapple. However, it lacks fertilizers and the agricultural inputs necessary to get good production, and sell at a better price, so that it is feasible for her to make a profit and so diversify her crops. 

She is thankful for the support provided by Kiva to women farmers in the rural areas of Nicaragua. They provide an example of how, despite the situation the country is facing, you can still move forward.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
A hardworking and very patient woman, Amelita is a 53-year-old widow with three grown children. She lives in the village of Marannao in the province of Isabela. She has managed her farm for 35 years with the help of her children. She earns approximately 16,000 PHP for every harvest. 

Amelita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a sack of seed corn and fertilizer for her farm. Amelita hopes that she can provide for the needs of her family so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children. Marcelina  is 59 years old, residing at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Marcelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 22 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 Pesos doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000.00 Pesos to purchase product to resell. Marcelina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Marcelina wants to build a house and finish her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase product to resell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem is a responsible mother who has spent most of her life working in the agricultural business in the Prey Chor district. She has lived there with her husband and 3 children for ages. Most of her main income is made from farming. Presently one of her daughters is married and works in a shoe factory in Phnom Penh city. Her husband always assists her on the same farmland to raise the whole family. Together, they typically earn approximately $2.50 per day. Mrs. Kem now is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL to pay for local laborers harvesting and threshing her rice crops. In the future, she will own a general store from her house and sell many kinds of merchandise to satisfy the people in her commune.

loans.use: to pay for local labors harvesting and threshing her rice crops.

loans.name: Iulieta

texts.en:
Iulieta is 40 years old and is married with 7 children.
Iulieta is starting a business venture, baking and selling cookies in the local community.  Iulieta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to fund her children`s education and support her family.

Iulieta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Iulieta's loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima is 48 years old and is married with 10 children.

Iemaima owns & operates a business venture: planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Iemaima needs a loan of WST $1750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Iemaima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Iemaima's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a married woman with nine children. Violeta is 52 years old, residing in the Philippines. Violeta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more goods to sell. Violeta joined GDMPC at this year. In the future, Violeta wants to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Ilen Marie

texts.en: Ilen Marie is a 23-year-old married woman with one child. She resides at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. To earn a living, Ilen Marie owns and operates a business venture, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns P4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of P5,000 to repair fishing boat for better service. Recently, Ilen Marie joined GDMPC to gain assistance in her business. In the future, Ilen Marie hopes to expand her business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To repair a fishing boat for better service.

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga is 40 years old and is married with 5 children.  Tusiga owns and operates a business venture, raising fish for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.    Tusiga needs a loan of WST $2000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.  Tusiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tusiga's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fish business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 58-year-old widow with three adult children. She lives in the village of Marannao, province of Isabela, where the major source of income of the community is raising crops. Narcisa is a very diligent and loving person. For every crop she earns P 20,000 after almost 30 years in business.

Narcisa is requesting a loan of P 18,000 to buy sacks of corn seeds, fertilizer, and to pay labor fees for her farm business. Aside from farming, she is also engaged in selling bananas in the community for additional income.

Narcisa hopes that some day she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer and pay labor fees for her farm

loans.name: Ta`e

texts.en:
Ta`e is 49 years of age and is married with 6 children.
Ta'e owns & operates a business venture, providing dress making services to local community members.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    Ta'e needs a loan of WST $2450 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Ta'e joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ta'e's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her dress-making business

loans.name: Faaniniva

texts.en:
Faaniniva is 36 years old and is married with 8 children.

Faaniniva owns and operates a business; raising cattle for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Faaniniva needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in the expansion of her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Faaniniva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faaniniva's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in the expansion of her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married and has one child. She is 31 years old and lives in Camanga Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Milagros owns and operates a gardening business venture in the agriculture sector to make a living.  She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 8,800 PHP from her business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Milagros has been a member of GDMPC for almost two years. In the future, Milagros wants to make improvements to her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mrs. Nem is 42 years old and she only has a low education. She has been blessed with 6 children. Most of them have independent lives and do not live under her income. Nem is a rice cultivator, who is hard-working and works alongside her husband on their farmland in the Prey Chor district. Next month, one of her children is going to marry and Mrs. Nem is the one who will take on the responsibilities of the wedding party. Mrs. Nem will pay a great expense for the preparation, yet she doesn’t have enough money for it. So she decided to look for help from HKL and Kiva in order to pay for all the things necessary for the wedding preparation. She is very grateful to all the lenders who have generously helped her family.

loans.use: to pay for all the things necessary for her child's wedding preparation.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon is married with 3 children. Ramon is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Ramon owns a rice wholesale store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns PHP 200,000.00 doing this type of work/business. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice wholesale business. Ramon has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Ramon hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
Soli is 59 years old and is married with 8 children.

Soli owns & operates a business venture: raising pigs for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  Soli needs a loan of WST $1750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Soli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Soli's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy  is married with one child. Mary Joy is 27 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Mary Joy earns her living as a wholesaler of goods and has had this business for six months. Each month, she earns PHP 150,000 doing this type of work/business. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase more wholesale stocks for her goods distribution business to grocery stores and general stores.

Mary Joy  has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale stocks for her goods distribution business to grocery stores and general stores

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 54 years old and is married with 5 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Sosefina needs a loan of WST $2,000 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 Talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Sosefina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sosefina's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Diodita

texts.en: Diodita is a 61-year-old single mother with one adult child. To earn a living, Diodita has a business raising pigs. She earns approximately P2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of P5,000 to purchase feed, medicine, and farm supplies for her piggery business. Diodita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for more than a year. In the future, Diodita dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed, medicine and farm supplies for her piggery business

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат молодой женатый мужчина,кредитуется в нашей организации с 2009 года. Он водитель пассажирского микроавтобуса на городской маршрутной линии и имеет очень ответственную профессию.После нашего информирования он узнал о нашей услуге и ему пришлась кстати это поддержка. Потому,что его микроавтобус часто требует ремонта и непредвиденных расходов,но под рукой нет постоянно наличных денег и он обратился к нам за поддержкой. С тех пор Фуркат непрерывно сотрудничает с нами и очень доволен нашими услугами. С его слов он намного улучшил свои жизненные условия, экономя свои ресурсы. Намерен в будущем на прерывать свой стаж кредитования и пользоваться нашими услугами. За период сотрудничества он также привлек несколько хороших клиентов в Арванд.
texts.en: Furkat is a young, married man, who has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2009.  He is a driver of a passenger minivan on a set municipal route and has a very responsible profession.  After hearing our information, he learned about our service, and this support became very timely for him.  Because his minivan often needs repairs and unforeseen expenses, but Furkat does not always cash to cover these, he came to us for support.  Since then, Furkat has been regularly partnering with us and is happy with our service.  According to his own words, he significantly improved his living conditions by saving his resources.  Furkat intends to continue maintaining his credit history and using our services.  Throughout the period of working with us, he also referred several good clients to Arvand.

loans.use: to repair his minivan

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 27-year-old, married businesswoman. She did not graduate from college due to early marriage. According to her, she settled for marriage at the age of 24. She is thankful because her husband is supportive of her decisions in life. The couple are blessed with two children.

Teresita has been managing her rice farming business for almost seven years and her variety store for three years. She grows rice on her three hectares of rice fields. Teresita is aiming to improve the rice field she manages so that she can provide for her family's needs. The income generated from her farming business goes to her obligations to traders with higher interest. Some of it is also utilized for their daily needs and electric bill payments. With the situation she faces nowadays, she is in need of additional working capital. So, Teresita is asking for a loan in the amount of P45,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides for her farming business. Using the loan, she can make her rice field more productive.

Teresita says that the key is to strive for the best to obtain success in life and manage the hardships in business. She also plans to increase sales at her variety store so that she can support her family's needs and save for her children's future and for emergency purposes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has two children. She is 34 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Gloria has a business venture, selling seafood products in the local community to earn a living and she has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Gloria has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to improve their house and to help complete her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jun Remy

texts.en:
Jun Remy is 38 years old and lives in Lalao, San Juan, Siquijor. Jun Remy is married with one infant child.

To earn a living, Jun Remy sells fresh caught fish from fishermen and delivers them to the market every day.  Each month he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fresh caught fish from fishermen and deliver them to the market.

Jun Remy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, he dreams of having enough savings to be used for the purposes of renovating his house.

loans.use: to buy fresh caught fish from fishermen and deliver them to the market.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children.

Bienvinido has a shop that sells bananas, coconuts, and vegetables. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and coconuts for resale.

Bienvinido has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bienvinido hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy bananas and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en: Mrs. Rit, age 49, has been a widow for many years, living with her two single children in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She is a responsible mother who has tried hard to support her children’s education. Recently her older child passed the examination to be a primary school teacher. She’s very proud of her child. Mrs. Rit is in the business of selling Khmer noodle (a kind of breakfast), a business located in her house. She typically earns an average of $2.00 per day. Mrs. Rit would like to ask for some funds from HKL to buy a stock of rice, from which she can make Khmer noodle. In the future, Mrs. Rit hopes to provide her last-born child with a further education.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Raul has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Raul has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Raul hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs needed to make roasted pigs

loans.name: Jerry Lou

texts.en:
Jerry Lou is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are students. He is married to a teacher and is busy managing his 1.2 hectare rice field. Jerry Lou is glad because he is able to provide his family needs through his wife's salary and income generated from his rice field. He is thankful because his previous loan enabled him to improve his farming business.

Jerry Lou would like to continually improve his farm but due to increased household expenses and high interest rates on his farm inputs he is asking for a additional loan of P27,000. He will use the amount requested to buy farm inputs to improve the growth of his rice crop. He is hoping that through his patience and new strategies for the plant care of his rice crop he can be able to increase his income. This way, he can support his children's education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his rice farming business

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun is 39 years old, living in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She cultivates rice crops for her livelihood. She has four male children who quit school to assist her farming work. Agriculture is the main source of her income. However, the farmland she owns will not provide the whole family a good income and a comfortable living. Consequently, Mrs. Khoeun wants to use her loan to expand her farmland and increase her rice production throughout the year. This loan will enable her to achieve her goal and better her living condition. In the future, she will strive to work harder and improve her farming business gradually.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Chanboreth

texts.en:
Chanboreth is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2009 and have one young daughter.   

Chanboreth and his wife are garment workers. They stay with his parents, but they want to live in separate home by building their own house. Hence Chanboreth is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to construct the building.

loans.use: To build his own house.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, pictured with her loom, is a 32-year-old weaver. Her husband is a chef. They have been married since 2000 and have three sons who are in school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey and her husband, Chamroeun, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son.

Raksmey and her husband are farmers; they grow ginger and yams on their farmland in the village where they live.

Raksmey is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm.   

Photo: Raksmey is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach and his wife are rice farmers. In addition, Mach also does construction work and his wife sells cake in the local market. 

Mach is asking for a loan for $400 to help him buy seed and fertilizer for his rice farm.

The couple has been married since 1998 and have three sons and one daughter. Three are in school and another one is still young. They live in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.


Photo: Mach is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To him buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rosie has a shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn, pictured with her loom, is a widow with one young son. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn is a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to renovate her house.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig is 39 years old and lives with his daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. He is a single father. His daughter is a school student. He started his business in 2006 by selling meat. In 2010, he started selling religious articles instead of meat. This business is much more profitable and easy on him, however it requires additional money in order to run it. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy religious supplies. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "The meat retailing business income was difficult to support my daughter. Now my antique business is paying off, however due to the lack of supplies, I am losing a lot of customers".

loans.use: To buy religious supplies.

loans.name: Sokhieng

texts.en:
Sokhieng (pictured with her young son and daughter), age 38, is a rice and lotus farmer. She also runs a tailoring business when she is free from farming. Her husband, Hourn, age 37, is a security guard. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhieng is asking for her first loan of $400 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice and lotus farm

loans.name: Jerly

texts.en:
Jerly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jerly has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stock from AVON to sell.

Jerly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jerly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Sokrem

texts.en:
Sokrem (in the photo), age 23, is single and lives with her father in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her father buys and sells cows.    

Sokrem is a cleaner. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to help provide capital to her father to buy additional cows to resell.

loans.use: To provide capital to her father to buy additional cows to resell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Cheryl has a shop that makes & sells snacks like pan & rice cakes or suman. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang is a mother of 2 children and works in the farming business. She and her husband grow rice crops twice a year on her farmland. She has been trained in this type of work by experience, so even though she works in the field for the whole day, it is nothing to her. The important matter is that the business is providing for the basic necessities of her children. She is able to earn approximately $2.00 per day through this business. 

Mrs. Seang would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy rice seeds and to pay local laborers to plow her field. This loan will enable her to start growing her dry-season rice crops. She is very happy and very thankful.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay local laborers to plow her field.

loans.name: Erdenehuu

texts.en:
Erdenehuu is a 55 years old single mother who lives with her daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in eastern Mongolia. Her daughter is a cab driver. 

Erdenhuu started her business journey in 2000 by operating a meat-selling business. In 2010 she expanded her business, renting a counter in the market and selling garments. Her garment retailing business is going well. Her products are very stylish, high quality and cheap, therefore she has many regular customers. 

Now that winter has arrived, she needs to sell warm clothes. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase garments from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To purchase garments from Erlian to sell

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Romelita has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands (tasty dishes) like afritada (tomato-based chicken dish) & caldereta (beef stew). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Romelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nancy owns a shop where she makes and sells tofu, or soybean/bean curd pudding. She has had this business for 4 years. 

Nancy has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the ingredients needed for making tofu. In the future, she hopes to improve her business. 

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed for making tofu.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

For 5 years, Esterlita has had a shop selling personal care products such as detergent, soap & perfume. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy personal care items to stock and sell. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

loans.use: to buy personal care items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is a merchant. 
Huong runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods, many kinds of rice and beverages to people in the local community. She started this business in 2004. 

She has requested a loan to purchase rice, beverages, and a range of other products to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beverages, and a range of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. For 5 years, Rizalina has had a food shop that sells balot, or hard-boiled duck eggs. Rizalina has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more duck eggs to make balot to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her business. Rizalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs for making balot to sell.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rubilyn has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rubilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rubilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Hermenia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Hermenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hermenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maribeth has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, kutsinta and suman. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Meraluna has a shop that sells spices, food seasoning and vegetables, like eggplants and cabbages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables.

Meraluna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Meraluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Арзигул имеет средне – специальное образование. Она по специальности бухгалтер. В этой области она проработала год. На сегодняшний день она занимается посевом зерновых культур. В основном Арзигул арендует участок земли и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Кредит берет для взятия в аренду земли и покупки семян.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in the J.Rumy region. She is 50 years old, married. Her husband has left to work in Russia. Arzingul herself has an advanced degree and has been working as an accountant for a year. She also grows grains for sale, mostly wheat, on rented land. She is requesting this loan to rent land and purchase seeds for planting.

loans.use: To rent land and purchase seeds

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosemarie has a beauty shop that provides hair cuts, manicure and pedicure. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy the materials needed for the beauty salon.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed for the beauty salon

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosalie has a shop that sells snacks, food seasoning and spices, like onions & garlic. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy snacks, food seasoning and spices.

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, food seasoning and spices

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Merly has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Susan has a shop that sells food seasoning, spices and vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy spices, food seasoning and vegetables to sell.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasoning and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sobirdjon

texts.ru: Собирхон житель района Джиликул. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Собирхон зарабатывает путем разведения мелко – рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят и овец.
texts.en: Sobirdjon lives in the Jilikul region. He is 21 years old and single. He has been raising sheep for sale for six years already. Sobirdjon is requesting this loan to purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Magdalena has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Magdalena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Magdalena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Luzviminda has a shop that sell food seasoning, snacks and spices. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy food seasoning, snacks and spices.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, snacks and spices

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Romel provides a motorcycle or habal-habal service. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service.

Romel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service

loans.name: Pamela Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Pamela Sharon Rose is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Pamela Sharon Rose has a computer shop that provides computer encoding and the photocopying of documents. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the materials needed for the computer shop.

Pamela Sharon Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed for the computer shop

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Edna has a shop that sells food seasoning, spices and vegetables like cabbages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables to sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Cristina has a shop that sells food seasonings, spices and fish such as trout and sardines. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy food seasonings, spices and fish to sell.

Cristina joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices and fish to sell

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. Он продает хозяйственные товары и телевизоры. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Дилшод имеет высшее образование. По профессии он экономист. Он живет вместе с родителями. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dilshod has been working in retail for five years and sells household supplies and televisions. He is 26 years old, married and has a young child. Dilshod has a college degree in economics but his family still lives with his parents. Dilshod is applying for this loan so that he can expand his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs and parabolic antennas

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Clarita has a shop that sells snacks and fruit such as mangoes and apples. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy snacks and fruit to sell.

Clarita joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Clarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and fruit to sell

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.en:
Filomeno is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children.

Filomeno is providing motorcycle taxi (habal-habal) services. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service.

Filomeno joined HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Filomeno hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a resident and a farmer in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. He is aged 50 and married with 3 children; the first two are adults. His farm produce of milk and tea go to the local market. He also gets additional income from his retail business in the local market.

James has made a loan request from Juhudi Kilimo for 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will help improve the family livelihood. He intends to do intensive breeding once his dairy business is well established.

He adds the future will be great with the financial services available from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Diana has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She has been in active farming for 10 years besides running a carpentry shop in the local market. She is married with four children, three of whom are of school-going age. Her farm produces maize, milk and vegetables that are sold to the local market.

She has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use her income for increasing her dairy business to four dairy cows, and also to buy a motorcycle to supply her produce to the market. 

Margaret laments of rampant animal diseases and the shortage of feeds during dry seasons as the major farming challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a food shop or carenderia that sells snacks & meals like caldereta (beef stew), afritada (tomato based stew) & halang-halang (spicy chicken). She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making meals & snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making meals & snacks.

loans.name: Biacca

texts.en: Biacca is 21-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food from a stall in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and onions.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Margie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Она занимается выращиванием овощей. Кроме того она сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the Jilikul district. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She grows vegetables, and also plants fruit trees. She has been involved in this business for ten years. She is requesting a loan for planting wheat.

loans.use: to plant wheat

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. Marlon provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline needed for the service. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marlon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Anale

texts.en: Anale is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. In the picture is Anale and her son. She makes and peddles meals like ginisang gulay (vegetable saute), & afritada (stew). She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anale hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling from a food stall in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts, beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 54, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of two children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jocelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Gemma has a bakeshop that sells breads, cakes & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a proud farmer. He has been growing rice as his source of income for almost 20 years. According to him, he still needs to improve and further develop his business to increase his earnings. Romeo has three children that attend school and need daily allowances.

Romeo is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy three bags of rice seed and eight bags of fertilizer. With the help of this loan, he will make his crop produce an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Romeo would like to provide a better education for all of his children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seed and eight bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the food she sells

loans.name: Saban

texts.en:
Saban, 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is an A KOUR cake vendor (decorated eggless cakes). Her husband and her son are mechanics who repair motorbikes and bicycles at home. She also needs to look after her mother who is very old. 

Therefore, Saban is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to run a new business by carrying yams to resell. By doing so, she can make more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to run a new business by carrying yams to resell.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and is married with three children between the ages of 22 and 16, with the last two still in school. She has been in active farming for 5 years and sells her produce of milk and maize to the local market.

Prisca has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to expand her dairy farming by buying and insuring an additional dairy cow at 31,200 KES as well as to venture into poultry farming by purchasing poultry birds with the remaining 30,000 KES. She aspires to be among the leading dairy farmers in the future.

Prisca mentions recurrent animal diseases as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan, for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Begali

texts.ru: Бегали житель района Джиликул. Возраст, 33 года. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. Он занимается посевом хлопка, пшеницы и выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Begali lives in the Jilikul district. He is 33 years old, married, and has six children. He harvests cotton and wheat, and grows vegetables. He is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Mrs. Chea, 38 and a mother of two school-aged children, has been involved in a farming business. She grows her rice two times a year because she gets enough water from the nearby river. It doesn’t matter for her to do a lot of work at the field but the problem is that her family doesn’t own any powerful animals for such kind of work. In general, she rents her neighbor’s cows to plow her rice field, and it will cost a lot. So now she would like to seek a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase two cows for working on her farmland. It will help the family reduce some expenses and can increase the productivity.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for working on her farmland.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, age 46, who is a resident of Pasay City in the Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a vendor, and she is a mother of four children. She, along with her husband and children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nida dreams of being able to give all her children a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, for three years.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon is 25 years old and married, although he is not yet blessed with children. He has been active in farming for four years and currently produces maize and beans, which he sells locally. He also trades in timber for additional income.

Zablon has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture will earn him more income due to the ready demand for milk. He wants to make farming the source of his family's livelihood. He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in five years.

Zablon says a network of poor roads and rampant diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Голибджон умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет двое детей. Пять лет назад он начал заниматься выращиванием арбуза, вначале ему было трудно работать на земле, а потом постепенно привык, и добавил участок земли и выращивал лука. Голибджон хочет хорошо обеспечить и кормит своих детей и с этой целью он продвигается вперед. Голибджон хочет расширить выращивание лука и его собственные средства не хватает на это и поэтому он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Golibjon is a smart and hardworking person.  He is married and has two children.  He started to grow watermelons five years ago, and at first, he found it difficult to work on the land, but then, he gradually got used to the work and added a plot of land to grow onions.  Golibjon wants to provide for and feed his children well, and continues to move forward to achieve this goal.  He wants to expand his onion production, but does not have enough of his own means to do so.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000.  Golibjon relies on your help and is grateful to you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to expand onion production

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, age 33, who is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Virginia is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Virginia hopes to increase her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Danston

texts.en:
Danston is 51 years old and has been in farming for 20 years. His farm currently produces maize, milk and vegetables for the local market. He earns additional income from his employment as a machine attendant in a local factory.

Danston has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he wants to diversify his farming business and hopes he will be able to adequately meet his family's needs from the farming income. He says his top priority is the education of his children, six of whom are still in school. He also aspires to intensify his dairy farming and become a breeder in the future.

Danston says the major challenge in dairy farming is sourcing quality animals since there are no trusted breeders in the area coupled with a lack of government records for breeds, which makes identification of quality breeds a nightmare for farmers.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru: Мухайё занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где сеет подсолнух и пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Muhayyo is involved in agriculture.  She leases a plot of land, where she sows sunflowers and wheat.  She has been involved in this type of business for ten years.  Muhayyo is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase their stationery stock.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has operated a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.

Leila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is single and has operated a motorcycle transportation business for the last seven months. 
He borrowed some money and added some of his personal savings, which enabled him purchase a motorcycle. 

Micheal heard about Milango from friends, and decided to join in order to finance his business. He is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 to help pay for another motorcycle. He will use the extra income from this loan to improve his savings and to purchase other assets.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат занимается скотоводством уже более 10 лет с целью увлечения поголовья скота. Несколько лет он был на заработках в России, и деньги ему достались с трудом, приехав в свой дом, сразу же начал заниматься скотоводством. На заработанные деньги купил 8 голов овца и 2 голов корову, таким образом, за годами он увеличил поголовье скота. В данный момент он имеет 40 голов овца и 6 голов корову.  Сегодня он нуждается расширить сарай своего скота, потому что они не поместится в зиме, а если он не строит сарай для них, а то ему придется продавать часть овца, но сегодняшней день в базаре покупает по низкой цене и ему не выгодно продавать их. Шавкат запрашивает займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки стройматериалов для постройки сарая, а на остаточную сумму хочет купить овца и корма для них. Шавкат надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Shavkat has been involved in animal husbandry for over ten years, with the goal of increasing livestock headcount.  He spent several years working in Russia, and earning that money was not easy.  He returned home and got involved in animal husbandry right away.  Shavkat used his earnings to purchase eight heads of sheep and two heads of cattle and was able to increase livestock headcount over the years like this.  Currently, he has forty heads of sheep and six heads of cattle.  Today, he needs to expand the barn for his livestock because it will not fit there in the winter.  If Shavkat does not build a barn for the livestock, then he would have to sell some of the sheep, which would not be economical, since he is buying sheep at low prices now.  Shavkat is requesting a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to purchase construction materials to build a barn, and to use the rest of the money to purchase sheep and fodder for it.  Shavkat relies on your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a barn, and to purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in eastern Mongolia. His wife works in a factory, his two eldest kids are school students, and the youngest one is a kindergarden student. 

Erdenetsogt operates taxi business. He started his taxi business in 2009 with his own motorcycle. He is a well-experienced driver. With his profits, he  then bought a car for his taxi business. His business income is enough to support his family. However, now that his car is old, nobody wants to sit in it.

He is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy new car. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "My income is decreasing rapidly. I have to act aggressively in order to make this right."

loans.use: to buy new car.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 33, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edilberto, a welder, and mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Alma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000-peso loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alma dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Onorkhon

texts.ru: Онорхон занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ей 41 год. У нее двое детей. Онорхон берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Onorkhon is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  Onorkhon is 41 years old and has two children.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food from a stall in Yambio, South Sudan, for five years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onion and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onion and rice to sell

loans.name: Marieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta o seu cunhado que vive com ela. 

É comerciante ha mais de 11 anos e tem um rendimento de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (chapas, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, 16.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt todos para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa para oferecer conforto a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children who attend school. She completed 6th grade and stopped for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her brother-in-law who lives with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 11 years and earns an income of 4.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her home (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 7.000, 16.000 and 20.000mt, all for personal housing expenses.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home in order to provide comfort for her family. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Undurbaatar

texts.en: Undurbaatar is 59 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is employed, and his daughter is a college student. He started his taxi business in 2005 with his own car. Now that winter has arrived, he needs to maintain his car in order to run his business through a harsh winter. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "It is very hard in winter to run a taxi business. If I maintain it properly, I am very confident that I can run my business." He is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a 47-year-old married woman who has been residing in Kompong Cham Province. She has been there and cultivated rice crops for ages. Farming is the only work she can do for her livelihood because she received only a low level of education. She has one single child who is now working as a local laborer. In the community, there is a lake where Mrs. Van and her husband can grow lotuses. After her lotus fruit becomes ripe, Mrs. Van will sell it in bulk, or sometimes retail, in a local market in the province. 

At the present time, Mrs. Van is looking for some funds from HKL to buy lotus seeds and start growing them in the lake. Through this loan and her project, Mrs. Van will be able to generate extra profit and better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy lotus seeds and start growing them in the lake

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en: Sophany, 45, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Sophany is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a new business selling groceries at home, renew her house, and support her children in their studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 year old, a married woman with no child. 

She has had a business of selling tea in Yambio, South Sudan for one year.

Elizabeth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and tea leaves. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a mechanic, and is mother to their children. She has managed to support her children's schooling. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melinda oversees operations of their jeepney  transportation business (see footnote). They have one jeepney with a 14- to 16-person capacity. Melinda and her husband also manage their motor repair shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy new accessories and parts for their jeepney and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melinda dreams to be able to buy another jeepney. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for accessories and spare parts for their jeepney and equipment for their repair shop.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en: Tsovinar lives with her son. She is a teacher at the local school. To cover the family's daily costs, Tsovinar has been engaged in farming for more than eleven years. Now Tsovinar needs financial means to develop her farm. Tsovinar plans to purchase flower seeds and grow flowers in her greenhouse. Tsovinar hopes she will grow flowers successfully and get more income from the sales. This will allow her to make savings for further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds

loans.name: Trerk

texts.en:
Trerk, 64, is widowed and resides with two daughters and four grandchildren in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is unemployed, but she stays home and looks after her grandchildren. Her daughters are employed at the garment factory. 

Trerk is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her grandchildren to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Nome

texts.en:
Nome is 35 years old, a married woman with five children. Three of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan, for nine years.

Nome is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony, 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is a housewife. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are garment workers. 

Sony is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cosmetic and decorative material to run a beauty salon. By doing so, she can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic and decorative material to run a beauty salon.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. 

Her husband runs a cell phone repair service, her elder three children are school students and the younger one is a kindergarten student. 

She started her garment retailing business in 1999 by renting a counter in the market. Her products are stylish, high quality and cheap. Also, she makes pendant earrings and sells them. 

Now that holiday season is approaching, she needs to buy additional supplies. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes for the new year.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the new year.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Group

texts.en:
Blantina is a 49-year-old mother of four, among them one child receiving a secondary education. She has been producing maize for over three years. She is also dealing with business activities buying and selling fish. She is getting a low income due to the number of problems facing agricultural activities such as crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Blantina is looking for a new source of funds that can help her to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also she is working hard to expand her scale of production from 2 to 10 acres that can lead to an increase in her income. 

In photo attached there are seven members of the group and three members names available are those with Kiva loan and the rest four members don't have loan.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais apenas 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela. 

É comerciante e vende pordutos diversos ha mais de 5 anos e conta com apoio do seu marido que tambem recebe uma pensão, por mês consegue um rendimento de cerce de 7.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de 10.500.00mt, e 12.000.mt para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has seven children, only one of which still attends school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her grandson who lives with her.
She has been selling various products for over five years and, with help from her husband who also receives a retirement pension, she earns an income of about 7.500mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 10.500 and 12.000mt, for personal housing expenses.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home and to set up a business. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Ket, 51, is a hardworking and responsible mother of six children living in Kompong Cham province. 

To earn a living, Ket is involved in agricultural businesses such as cultivating rice crops and raising poultry at home. She typically earns in the neighborhood of $2 per day.
