Ket is going to prepare a wedding party for her son soon, yet due to the lack of capital, Ket cannot manage the party as well as expected. So now she turns to our lenders to ask for funds to prepare her son’s wedding party that will be held in the next few weeks. She is appreciative and she promises to pay her loan back punctually.

loans.use: to prepare her son’s wedding party.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 24-year-old married woman with three children. None of them are in school. 

She has had a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan, for three years.

Monica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for resale.

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Samey, 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She is a housewife. Her husband is a security guard. 

Samey is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase wood to repair her house in order to make it more comfortable for living. 

In the future, she would like to run a new business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for finishing his house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of 8, ages between 27 and 17 with the last two still schooling. She has been in active farming, specifically poultry and dairy farming. She has been selling her products within the local markets for the last 5 years. She is 48.

Beatrice has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to improve her poultry business by buying more birds. She says this loan will increase her poultry to 700 in number and improve her farming income, which she will use to uplift the living standards of her children.

She too, mentions farmers lose much of their income due to poultry diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: I Nyoman

texts.en:
I Nyoman, 54, is an elementary school teacher who lives in the village of Blimbingsari, western Bali. He has been a teacher for 26 years. He has two daughters, the first daughter has finished college and the second is still in high school. His wife is a housewife who works in the garden and raises pigs. 

I Nyoman is making a serious effort to raise pigs because the results are very helpful for the family economy. One of the results is to help finance his daughter's college education. Currently he has 10 sows and a 56 square meter cage. At this time he sells piglets and fattening pigs for rolling pigs. 

Having more than five pigs of course generates a lot of manure. Up till now to manage the pigs' manure, he used it for organic fertilizer. However, due to an increasing number of pigs, I Nyoman felt overwhelmed because of the air pollution they generated. In addition to pollution, they created an unhealthy environment as well. 

Hearing of the biogas program from MUK, I Nyoman immediately joined. He wanted to turn pig manure that had been considered pollution into something useful. During this time he used two LPG gas cylinders every month. Each gas cylinder weighs 15 kg and costs 82,000 Rupiah (IDR). With the biogas, he hoped to be able to save on expenses to cover the kitchen. Besides, this program supports environmental conservation programs announced by the government.

loans.use: To make a biogas reactor

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Chreb is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase oxen to yoke for plowing the rice field. In the future, she would like to run a new business, renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase oxen for plowing the rice field

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Oyundelger is 23 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her son is a kindergarten student. 

Oyundelger operates a grocery product trading business. She started her business in 2010 by renting a grocery shop. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she's a very talented business woman. Her customers are increasing, therefore she needs to increase her range of products. She 's a sharp and hardworking woman who's requesting 630,000 MNT to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children not in school. She has had a business of selling fish in yambio South Sudan for five years.

Jenifer is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola. Fez a 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

É Servente de bar ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, e outros). O primeiros emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para habitação.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children who attend school. She completed 5th grade and stopped for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two nephews who live with her.
She has been a bartender for over 10 years and earns a salary of 3.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 10.000mt, for personal housing.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her home in order to offer more comfort for her family. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Phor

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Mrs. Phor operates a hog-raising business to generate income. She is 31 years old and has one school-aged child. Her husband manages their rice farming business and takes some free time to act as a fisherman. Sometimes the family experiences financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities and school fees since her son studies in high school, but with his parents' help, he’ll be able to supplement his needs. 

Mrs. Phor aims to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise. She believes that the loan will help her to improve her business if she works hard and strives harder. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, and breeding livestock to raise.

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn, 33, is married and resides with her husband, three children, and an elderly mother in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are construction workers. 

Roeurn is requesting a loan of 1200 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase wood to build a new house. By doing so, she will have a convenient house in which to stay. In the future, she would like to send her children to a mechanic training center and support them in studying higher.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a new house.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her kids are all independent and employed. 

Tuya operates a bakery business. She started her bakery business in 2007. Even though her bakery is small, it is well known around the neighborhood for excellent taste. She bakes two kinds of breads. Her product demand is increasing; however, she couldn't keep up with it due to the shortage of raw materials. She is requesting 700,000 Mongolian tughriks (MNT) to buy one ton of flour and one ton of coal.

loans.use: To buy one ton of flour and one ton of coal.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte de seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.

É negociante ha mais de 10 nos dedica-se a venda de roupa usaada, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem diculdades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a sua casa (cimento, pedra, chapas, barrotes, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de 8.000.00mt, para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa, para tal tensiona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is a widow and has four children, only one of which still attends school. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years. She sells used clothing and earns an income of about 3.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.). The first loan was for 8.000mt, for the retail business.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building her house and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cement, stone, metal sheets, rafters, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Malysiana is a 60-year-old married woman with three children. She has been doing well in growing maize, coffee and beans for over 11 years. She is working hard to overcome agricultural problems such as lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Malysiana spends most of her time to find working capital that can help her to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. She has an opportunity to boost her scale of production from 5 to 13 acres in the next five years. Also, by improving her farming activities, she can generate income that can be used to buy clothes, cover medical expenses, and repair her family house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Thoeurn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband, Heng, is a construction worker. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Thoeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Ritha is 40 years old, married, and has six children who attend school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, which she has been doing for eight years.

Ritha is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela.

É negociante ha mais de 10 anos dedica-se a venda de alho em grandes quantidades e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente desta inastituição.Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar alho para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 15.000.00mt.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende mobiliar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has four children, only one of which still attends school. She completed 6th grade and stoppes for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports a niece who lives with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 10 years. She sells garlic in bulk and earns an income of about 4.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase garlic in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The first loan was for 15.000mt.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to furnish her home and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase garlic for selling.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 40 years old,  married, and has two children.  She resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. 

Pov is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her children can easily arrive at work on time. Besides farming, she hopes to run a grocery store at home and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 32 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. Riza has a used clothing business in the Philippines, which she has had for three years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Riza is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more used clothing to sell. In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Rice farming is what Ma.Luz and her husband do for a living. They usually earn about P20,000 during harvest season in April and November. They culitivate a two-hectare plot of land where they grows rice. The couple has one child who is still in elementary school. As of now, the couple needs additional capital to sustain their rice crop so that it will produce an abundant harvest. Ma. Luz is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use in farming.

Ma.Luz would like to keep growing rice and improve their farming practices so that it will enables them to make their business more profitable in the future. She would like to earn enough income for the college education of her child.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to use in farming

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 47 years old, is married, and has 1 child in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more goods such as soap, soft drinks, and slippers to sell in her store.

Melodia has previously requested and repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from a butcher shop. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as soap, soft drinks, and slippers to sell in her store.

loans.name: Phân

texts.en:
Mrs. Phân is 58 years old and a widow who works as a local cultivator in Kompong Cham province. She has had to be very hard-working in order to raise her 7 children, 3 of whom are married and live independently with their new families. She also raises piglets at home to generate extra income. In addition, 3 of her daughters are working as garment factory sewing staff in Phnom Penh city and contribute some of their income to help the family.

With a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodian riel (KHR), Mrs. Phân will buy breeding piglets to raise. She thanks the financial institution for its constant support, which enables her to achieve her projects in the hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy breeding piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em, 34, is pictured above in her house. She is a local farmer and hog-raiser living in the Baray district. She has a common-law marriage, and her husband trades animals in the provincial marketplace. Together, the couple earns an income of $6.00 per day from their businesses. Mrs. Em has saved some of this income and kept it for future business. She’s a hopeful mother who always takes care of the family and maintains her business growth. 

With a loan of  3,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) from Kiva partner HKL, Mrs. Em will buy a rice-husking machine for her family's use and to provide rice-husking services to local villagers in exchange for money. She will also use the loan to purchase 10 heads of piglets to raise in her wooden pigpen. In the future, she hopes to be able to attain a better quality of life and provide her children with further education.

loans.use: to buy a rice-husking machine and piglets

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Costansia is a 41-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are attending primary school. She has performed well in the production of coffee, maize, and beans for over eight years. She has been facing farming problems, basically because of lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Costansia is working hard to find more funds to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, she is working hard to expand her scale of production from 6 to 14 acres, so that in five years to come she may be able to build a better house, to cover medical expenses, and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она медсестра и у нее низкая зарплата и это не хватает на содержании семьи. Её муж не живет с ней уже 5 лет и все заботы и проблемы семьи в её плечах, кроме того у неё проблемы со здоровьем, поэтому ей очень тяжело содержит двоих детей.  Чтобы перешагнут все эти трудности она начала заниматься скотоводством для того чтобы немножко улучшить финансовое положения семьи. Шарофат запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота и корма для них. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Sharofat is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is a nurse and has a low salary, which is not enough to support her family.  Her husband has not lived with her for five years, and all of the family's worries and problems reside on her shoulders.  Besides this, Sharofat has health issues, which makes it more difficult for her to support two children.  In order to get past all of these difficulties, she got involved in animal husbandry to slightly improve the family's financial situation.  Sharofat is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni to purchase livestock and fodder for it.  She relies on your help and mercy.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 53, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a contractor, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Olivia works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Olivia hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is 39 years old, married and has three children. Teodoro is an experienced farmer. He has been growing rice for almost 20 years now. Through his income, he provides meals, allowances and other basic needs for his family. Teodoro now realizes that he should increase his income as his family's expenses for allowances and meals have been increasing. He is asking for P30,000 to buy 18 bags of fertilizers and pesticides to improve his crop production and yield for abundant harvest.

Through his farming activities, Teodoro aims that someday, he can make his family live progressively.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of fertilizers and pesticides for use in farming

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from the village of Kvashta, in mountainous Adjara, West Georgia. He is 35 years old and lives with his family: his wife Sophia, his 2-year-old daughter, his father, and his brother. Sophia and his father work as teachers at the village school. Badri runs the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. He has a fish dam at his house and sells fish at the local market. The family also has a 0.3 hectare plot of land, where they grow fruits and vegetables that they sell to local greengrocers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Georgian laris (GEL). 

Badri has noticed that there is high demand for fish in the market. In response to the local market demand, he has requested credit to finance the costs of constructing a second dam, which he will build in his garden. With the additional dam, Badri will be able to sell twice the amount of fish, which will significantly increase the family's income, enabling them to increase their spending on household goods and thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for creating a fish dam

loans.name: Loeurt

texts.en:
Loeurt is 47 years old and married. She resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples such as Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.). She distils alcohol and raises pigs at home. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a rice farmer and raises seven buffaloes. 

Loeurt is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plow for personal use and rental. In the future, she would like to purchase more land to grow rice in the dry season, build a new house, and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a plow for personal use and rental

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him, age 63, is a local farmer as well as a hog raiser. She permanently lives in Baray district, Cambodia, with her husband and eight children. She has been engaged in rice farming since she was a young girl. She has gained a lot of experience with this type of work, and she grows her rice crops twice a year by using the water from the nearby river during a dry season.

At the present, Mrs. Him is preparing to grow her dry-season rice but she has inadequate funds to complete the process. Therefore she is taking out a loan from HKL to buy rice seed and fertilizer to start growing her crops. In the future, she hopes to enhance her farming business and buy necessary farming materials such as a plow and a pump.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kiwambi Tujitunze Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Yuditha is a 46-year-old married woman with one child. She has been doing well in producing coffee, maize and beans for over seven years. She has been earning low income due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Yuditha is finding working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, she has committed to increase her scale of production from seven to 18 acres in five years which can lead to generating more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
This is Agrifina, 44, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Agrifina operates a garlic and onion retail business. Garlic and onions are the staples of Filipino cuisine. Every dish must contain either one or both of these. She purchases wholesale onions and garlic, cleans and peels them, repackages them into 5- or 10-Philippine peso-bags, and then sells them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of sacks of garlic and onions for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Agrifina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of garlic and onion needed in her business.

loans.name: Berdikul

texts.ru: Бердикул имеет большую семью, их семеро, он, его жена и пятеро детей. С детство он помогал отцу, его отец занимался выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Сейчас он также занимается выращиванием лука. Бердикул старается расширить свой бизнес, чтобы мог обеспечить своих детей и дать образование всем им. Бердикул запрашивает займ для покупки семена лука. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Berdikul has a large family of seven, that includes himself, his wife and five children.  Since childhood, he has been helping his father, who was involved in growing agricultural crops.  Currently, Berdikul is also involved in growing onions.  He tries to expand his business in order to provide for his children and give all of them a good education.  Berdikul is requesting this loan for the purchase of onion seeds.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old and a farmer from the village of Ortabatumi, West Georgia. He lives with his family: his wife, Nargiz, and his 18-year-old daughter, Ilona. Ilona goes to school. David works in a local construction company. He works hard at his job, but still finds time to work on the family farm, which is an additional source of the income for the family. 

They have a dairy cow. Nargiz produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The family also has 0.5 hectares of land, on which they grow tangerines. Nargiz sells the harvested citrus to green grocer retailers. Their total average monthly income is 800 Laris. 

With the requested loan, David will purchase another dairy cow. The family will double their production and sale of cheese and increase their income. They will be able to purchase additional household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Thmor Koul district, where rice farming is common, 33-year-old farmer, Nha, has been farming her three hectares of farmland for six years. She has three dependent children, two of whom are still in school while the last one is too young to attend school. In addition, she works for others to raise additional income after the harvest. She currently earns around $5US per day. 

This is the first loan for her two-member group with VisionFund. Nha will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crop and also to develop more of her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and earn more income. This would enable her to build a decent house and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her rice crop.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира честная и добрая женщина, она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она занимается скотоводством более 4 лет. Сейчас она имеет 5 голов быка и одну дойную корову. Она рано утро доит корову, и продает молоко соседям, а также кормит семью молокам. Кроме этого она занимается дехканским хозяйством. Она изучила, как выращивать сельхоз культур, как посеять его, в каком сезоне и как полит. Выращивание приносит ей хороший доход. Гулмира хочет расширить скотоводство и запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и корма для них.  Она надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарна вам за ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulmira is an honest and good woman. She is married and a loving mother of two children. She has been working with cattle breeding for more than 4 years. Now she owns 5 bulls and a milk cow. Early in the morning she milks the cow, sells the milk to her neighbors, and also feeds her family with milk. In addition, she works with farming. She learned how to grow agricultural crops, how to sow it, in which season and how to water it. Plant cultivation brings her a good income. 

Gulmira wants to expand the cattle breeding and requests a loan for purchasing cattle and feed for them. She hopes for your support and is thankful to you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for them

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao operates a retail business from her house. She is 38 years old and a responsible mother of two children who attend a local public school. She sells many items like shampoo, powders, snacks, noodles, eggs and sweet things, earning approximately $1.50 per day. Mrs. Mao is going to expand her house and build an appropriate store for her business. What she really needs are funds from HKL and Kiva to supplement her savings to repair her house. In the future, she plans to sell many kinds of merchandise, enabling her to generate extra income.

loans.use: to repair and expand her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 21-year-old married woman with one child in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yambio, South Sudan for two years.
Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for resale.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. 

For four years, Loan has earned a living by running a general store. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This would help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. She has run a food stall in front of their house for the past nine years. She sells soups and noodles to people in her community. 

Thuy is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production.

loans.name: Nasibali

texts.ru: Насибали проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его жена и брат работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей. В этой области он более 20 лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Nasibali lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 43 years old, married and has four children.  His wife and brother work at a dekhan farm.  Nasibali is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for over 20 years.  He is requesting this loan for sowing wheat.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 37 year-old farmer from the village Ortsva, in mountainous Adjara. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. He works in a local construction company. His job is seasonal. Along with it, he is actively involved in family agricultural activities, which is the main source of income for the family. They grow fruits and vegetables on family-owned 0.8 hectare land. The harvested crop is sold to local greengrocery retailers. Also, the family runs a small dairy farm with 2 cows. Merab’s mother makes traditional Georgian cheese and sells it locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Merab requested credit for diversifying the family’s agricultural business. He plans to start a bee-keeping farm. With the credit, Merab will purchase 6-7 bee-hives and bee-colonies. Bee-keeping is quite well-developed in mountainous Adjara. Merab will sell the gathered honey at the local market. It will increase the income of the family. Merab plans to reinvest the income in the same business to purchase additional bee-hives.

loans.use: to purchase 6-7 bee-hives and bee-colonies

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2006. 

Hong is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 43 years, married and has one child. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a technician. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2006. 

Thu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Lich

texts.en:
Lich is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2005. 

Lich is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a large quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2004. 

Tuyet is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling..

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 51, is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a carpenter. 

Huong supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells sugar, confectioneries, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Cathelina

texts.en:
Cathelina is 38 year old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, which she has been doing for two years.

Cathelina is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 41 years old and has a daughter. Her husband earns an income working in interior decoration.

Phuong has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past seven years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities. 

Phuong would like to borrow money to expand her business by increasing the quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, that she sells from her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of basic goods and household necessities to stock her store.

loans.name: Sab

texts.en: Mrs. Sab is a 46-year-old married woman who has been living in Pouk district. She is in the business of cultivating rice and raising some poultry at home. She is blessed with 6 children, two of whom are single and live under her income. Mrs. Sab will start growing her dry-season rice. However, it’s not easy to get the water from the river unless she rents her neighbor’s pumping machine, which costs much money. Mrs. Sab wants to own a machine for her farming so she doesn't have to rent. For this reason, Mrs. Sab would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers and some poultry. She hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her crops and their lives as well. Someday, she aims to uplift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers and some poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his grocery inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama( en tricot gris avec des rayures)est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée à un électronicien et a 01 enfant.
Ama travaille comme revendeuse de mèches depuis 04ans. Elle est aidée par une personne et vend dans un marché de la place. Son approvisionnement se fait à ACCRA et à LOME.
Ama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches de toutes catégories. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ama voudrait agrandir son commerce et prendre bien soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ama (wearing a gray knit with stripes) is 27 years old. She is married to an electronics engineer and has one child.

Ama has been working as a retailer of hair locks for the past four years. She is assisted by one person and sells in a local market. She resupplies in Accra and Lome.

Ama has requested her first WAGES credit loan to purchase different types of hair locks, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Ama would like to expand her business and take good care of her family.

loans.use: Buy hair locks

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.ru: Мехрихон жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается растениеводством. В этой области она уже семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mehrikhon is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. She grows crops and has been in this business for seven years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Elivilia

texts.en:
Elivilia is 26 year-old married woman with two children, one of them in school. She has had a food stall in Yambio, south Sudan for two years.
Elivilia is requesting this loan through BRAC, south Sudan, to purchase beans, rice and sugar for her stall. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Kawsar

texts.en: Kawsar is a 37-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and six children who are still studying. She’s cooperating with her husband to be able to cover their children’s study fees and improve their lives. She has owned a toy shop since 2009. As for her husband, he has been working as a soldier at the Lebanese army. Today, she’s looking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more toys for her shop such as video games, fireworks, puzzles and many other items. In that way, she can respond rapidly to her customers' demands and increase her sales. In the future, she plans to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase toys for her shop such as video games, fireworks, and puzzles

loans.name: Koudiratou

texts.fr:
Koudiratou est une femme  âgé(e) de 34ans. Elle est veuve et a 04 enfants en charge.
Koudiratou travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames frites et pâtes alimentaires depuis 2006. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place et est aidée par 02 personnes.
Koudiratou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames,de l’huile et de la boisson locale
texts.en:
Koudiratou is a 34-year-old woman. She is a widow with four children to care for.

Since 2006 Koudiratou has been retailing fried yams and pasta. She sells in her local neighborhood, assisted by two persons.

Koudiratou requested her first loan from WAGES to buy yams, vegetable oil and local beverages.

loans.use: Buy goods for her business (yams, vegetable oil and others)

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Chem is 46 years old, married and has three children. His children work at the Thai border. To earn a living, he farms on his two-hectare plot of farmland in a village of the Moung Russey district, which he has been doing for more than 35 years.

Chem leads a group of two members. He has been with VisionFund for five years, while his fellow group member began with VisionFund for this loan term. The previous loans have provided him with sufficient capital to operate his business and to generate regular income. He is now applying for another loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. With the loan proceeds, he hopes to increase his crop yield and to thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 30-year-old, married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their two school-age children. She works really hard with her husband in order to earn money and to build a good future for their children.

She started her own home business in 2002, where she sells groceries such as sugar candies, chocolate, and sweets. She explains that she is very good at selecting products that her customers will want. She also sells clothes from her home.

She is now looking to further grow her business. As a result, she is seeking to borrow $2,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more groceries for her business in order to increase her sales and profits. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. После распада СССР её муж потерял свою работу, из-за этого ей приходилась обеспечить семью и она начала заниматься  бизнесом. Она занимается купле- продажей бытовой техники на местном рынке, у неё хороший опыт и она имеет много клиентов. От полученной прибыли она хочет обучить своих детей, то есть устроит их в ВУЗ-ах для того чтобы они стали хорошими специалистами в своем деле. Мунира запрашивает займ для покупки бытовой техники с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Munira is married and is a loving mother of two children. She is very hardworking and a good woman. After the collapse of the USSR her husband lost his job and because of this she had to provide for her family and she began to do business. She does buying and selling of household appliances on the local market, she has a good experience and a lot of customers. She wants to use the received profit to educate their children by enrolling them in a university so they can become good specialists in their field.

Munira is asking for a loan to purchase household appliances in order to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase of household appliances.

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr:
Blaise est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants, 
Blaise travaille comme revendeur des matériaux de construction depuis 2008. Il vend dans un quartier de la place et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Blaise a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des  matériaux de construction.
texts.en:
Blaise is a 36-year-old man. He is married to a retail merchant and has two children.

Blaise has been working as a dealer of building materials since 2008. He sells in a local neighborhood and resupplies at the Grand Market in Lome.

Blaise requested his first WAGES credit loan to purchase building materials.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 35-year-old, married man with three children. For three years, he has been working as a wheat farmer; during that time, he has had good harvests.

He is now applying for his second loan through KADET ltd, which he will use to buy wheat seeds and to prepare his land for additional farming activities. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of this loan, he plans to pay for his children's school fees.

He has dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He explains that he is an assiduous man who works hard to succeed despite the fact that he has very limited resources.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds and to improve his land

loans.name: Abdel Mouin

texts.en:
Abdel Mouin is a 51-year-old, married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and their two children. Both of his children attend school. He explains that he really cares about his children's future, and wishes that they receive higher education.

For that reason, he started to work from his home as a private teacher in the year 2000. For the past seven years, he has also been working as a teacher in a local school.

Now, he is seeking to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay for his children’s educational fees. He notes that this will help them continue with their education until they graduate. In the future, he hopes to receive more Kiva loans and to help his children enter college and pursue master degrees.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она выращивает бахчевые культуры и овощи. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Muhabbat is involved in agriculture.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows melons crops and vegetables.  Muhabbat is 46 years old, married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a hardworking woman who is in the business of selling water. She has been engaged in this business for the last six years.

She was introduced to KADET by other women in a group in her area of residence. She is now applying for her first loan through KADET, which she plans to use to buy more water pumps so that she can distribute more water to the residents in her area.

She hopes to make a profit from this loan because she would like to start a grocery shop as a secondary business in order to generate more income. She dreams of being rich and stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy more water pumps

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr:
Essivi est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et n’a pas d’enfants.
Essivi travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de recharges et des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 2010. Elle vend à domicile et de façon ambulante à ses clients. Elle achète  ses marchandises (les cartes de recharges et les ustensiles de cuisine) à Lomé et à ACCRA.
Essivi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d'acheter des cartes de recharges et des ustensiles de cuisine. Il voudrait devenir grossiste de cartes de recharge et s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Essivi is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a merchant and has no children.

Essivi has been retailing phone recharge cards and kitchen utensils since 2010. She supplies her customers from her home and as an itinerant vendor. She replenishes her products (phone charge cards and kitchen utensils) in Lome and Accra.

Essivi requested her second WAGES credit loan to purchase phone recharge cards and kitchen utensils. She wants to become a wholesaler of phone recharge cards and see her business flourish.

loans.use: Buy phone recharge cards and other items

loans.name: Tananko

texts.en:
Tananko has been practicing crop farming for the last sixteen years. He is 56 years old, married, and supports seven people in his family.

He has been a good client, and he repaid his previous loans well. He has applied for his third loan, which he plans to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. 

In the future, he hopes to see his children prosper and be motivated to work hard in all that they do.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and also to hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem, 59, is a resident of Pouk district, Siem Reap province, where she grows rice and beans for her livelihood. Yem has been involved in farming for more than 12 years. She is a very an industrious mother who has managed her entire farming business since her husband passed away. She has 4 children; 3 of them have independent lives and are already married. So there is only one child who is supported by her income. Yem plans to support her last-born child until he finishes high school. 

Yem is taking out this loan to buy a pump that can used to provide water to her bean crops. She won’t worry about how to carry water from the river to water her crops any longer. Yem hopes that someday she will be able to buy a few pieces of land to increase her productivity in her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a pump.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more tires, car spray, tire rims, and oils.

loans.name: Sovanny's Group

texts.en:
Single and 29 years old, Sovanny is a farmer in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district. She supplements her income by raising pigs and chickens. She has been in this business for more than three years and she earns around five U.S. dollars per day. 

Sovanny leads a group of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for one year, while her group members have been with VisionFund from one year to five years. She is now requesting another loan. She wants to use the entire loan to buy more baby chickens for her business. This loan will enable her to increase her business and earn more income to make a better living and have a small farm for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy more baby chickens for her business.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар вдова и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле- продажей скота. Она начала свой бизнес с продажей молочных продуктов и скота и до сих пор продолжает этот бизнес. Более 10 лет она в этом бизнесе и имеет богатый опыт. Гавхар хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Гавхар хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Gavhar is a widow and a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She started her own business with the sales of dairy products and livestock and still runs this business now.  She has been in this business for over ten years and has a rich experience in it.  Gavhar wants to expand her business and make a good profit.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to refill her revolving capital.  Gavhar relies on your help and thanks you in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Chhev

texts.en: Chhev, 52, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chhev and her husband sell groceries and produce traditional baskets to sell. Chhev is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store and to help her son to repair his house. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to expand her grocery business. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store and to help her son repair his house.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 24 years old. He married a short time ago and lives now with his wife Nargiz and parents in the village Iremadzeebi, West Georgia. Jemal works as a truck driver in the village. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family's agricultural activities. They have 0.8 hectare land, where citruses and vegetables are grown. Also they have 8 milk cows. Jemal’s mother makes traditional Georgian cheese. Both the cheese and the harvested crops are sold locally to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Jemal requested credit for purchasing 2 additional milk cows. The family will produce and sell more cheese and their income will grow. With the increased income, Jemal’s family will be able to improve their living conditions, purchase more necessary household goods.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
A 57-year-old married mother, Neang is a farmer who has five children. Two of them are dependents working in Thailand. To make a living, she plants her rice paddy twice per year. She has been in this business for more than 40 years. 

Neang leads a group of three female members. She has been with VisionFund since 2008 while her group members have been with VisionFund from one to four years. Her previous loans have made her living better. Now she is applying for another loan. She will use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and save some money to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Hork

texts.en: Hork, 30, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Hork rents bicycles to tourists, and his wife sells seafood. Hork is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work in the town. By doing so, his family is able to generate more income. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to expand his grocery business. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her her husband to commute to work in the town

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut is a diligent and responsible housewife who resides in the Baray district. She cultivates rice during the rainy season as well as raising hogs in addition to farming. Typically, she can earn a profit of $1.50 per day from her hog-raising business. She works really hard in order to provide her children with basic necessities, especially education. She wants them to finish high school. Ut says that she is taking out this loan to buy a plow because it’s necessary for her farming business. In the future, she aims to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy a plow.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.ru: Рашид проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Образование у него среднее. Рашид занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы и моркови.
texts.en: Rashid lives in the Jilikul Region. He is 30 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a high school education. Rashid grows vegetables for sale, and he has been doing this for 7 years. He is taking out a loan to sow wheat and carrots.

loans.use: to sow wheat and carrots.

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en:
Married with four dependent children, Sivorn is a 28-year-old peasant. For ten years, she has been planting maize to feed her family, and her husband is a mechanic in the village. 

Sivorn now leads a group of two female members. This is her first loan, while her group member has been with VisionFund for one year. For the harvest season, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her maize crop. She hopes to increase her crop and earn more income to continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her maize crop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is 25 and married with one child, age 5, who is already attending school.She has 3 years of experience in mixed farming and currently supplies the local market with maize and tomatoes.

Lilian has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her start a poultry farming business in addition to her production of maize and vegetables. She says farming is the family's sole source of income, and the increased income through the loan will help her improve her family's living standards. She aspires to join the ranks of the major suppliers of poultry in the area.

Lilian mentions the high cost of feeds as a new challenge to farmers, in addition to a long spell of droughts.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer and the father of 3 children, aged 8 to 10 years. He has 7 years of experience in farming and currently supplies the local market with milk and eggs.

Patrick has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will enable him to meet the family's basic needs by providing milk and extra income for repaying the loan and meeting other needs. He hopes to grow the business and join the ranks of the major milk suppliers in the area.

Patrick mentions animal diseases as his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglass is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Western Kenya. He is married with six children all of whom are of school going ages. He has been in farming for six years with the farm currently producing maize and milk for the local market.

Douglass has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo, with the first one of being 25,000 KES. He says the loan will help him venture into his poultry farming business. He is optimistic that he will be able to service the loan with his farming returns due to high demand for poultry products in the area. He adds that the income will also help him boost his dairy farming and enable him to buy a motorcycle for taking supplies to the market.   

He mentions that diseases are the major impediment for farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Varlam

texts.en:
Varlam is a 32-year-old farmer from the village of Akhasheni, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his large family: wife - Mariam, two sons (9 and 5 years old), parents and grandparents. The primary source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have a 0.8-hectare vineyard. Also, the family grows tomatoes, melons and peaches on a family-owned 1.6 hectares of land. All harvested products are sold locally to retailers. In addition, the family has three calves. All adult family members are involved in farming; they work hard during the day on their farm. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,500 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Varlam’s grandparents. 

Varlam requested credit for purchasing fertilizers and hiring a tractor for tilling the land. After properly completing seasonal work, the family will get a good harvest. Varlam hopes that next fall, after selling the harvested products and grown calves, he will get enough funds to purchase a tractor. In the future, he will use the tractor for tilling of his land, as well as neighborhood plots. First, he will significantly save on the costs on tilling of his own land and second, he will get additional income from serving neighbor farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay the tractor owner for tilling services.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is 35 and has been in farming for five years in addition to her tailoring and retail shop business in the local market. Her farm produces milk and vegetables which she sells locally. She is married with three children ages between 11 and 23 years old.

Emily has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her increase the number of poultry birds so that she can enjoy the economies of scale that comes with high volume of operations. She says she will use the income to up lift the living standards of her children.

She mentions however that drought and animal diseases are the common challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose has been in farming for six years with his farm producing beans, eggs and maize for the local market. He says his family of six children, whose  ages are between 1 and 15 years, have been relying on farming as the only source of income.

Ambrose has made a request for a loan amounting to 61,200 KES to help him venture into dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and using the remaining 30,000 KES to boost his poultry farming by buying more poultry birds. He aspires to own five dairy cows in five years.

He mentions the high costs of feeds as the major farming challenge in the area.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Sareth's Group

texts.en:
Sareth is 34 years old, married and has only one son who is still in primary school in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district. She has been planting cassava as a primary business for five years while her husband works for others to raise extra income. With her current income source, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day. 

This is her first group loan with VisionFund. Leading a group of three female members, she is applying for a loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more cassava and earn more income to make a better living and also keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.ru: Эркинджон женат и имеет одного сына. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Ему нравится заниматься скотоводством, ведь этот бизнес приносить ему хорошую прибыль. Сейчас он имеет 5 голов быка. Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Данное время у него проблемы с финансами, но он очень усердно работает, чтобы выйти из трудного положения. Он очень трудолюбивый и старательный человек, он справляется с любыми трудностями. Эркинджон запрашивает займ для покупки скота и корма для них.
texts.en: Erkinjon is married and has one son. He has been raising cattle for over 10 years. He likes this work because his business brings him a good profit. At present he has five heads of cattle. He also plants crops. Currently he has financial difficulties, but he works very hard in order to overcome his  difficult situation. He is a very hard working and dedicated person. He can manage any  challenge. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a resident and a farmer in her home area of Kitale where she lives with her family of two children, ages one and four. She has been in farming for four years and currently produces maize and vegetables, which she sells to the local market. Farming is her sole source of income for her family's upkeep.

Emily has made a loan request of 50,000 KES and she states that she will use the loan to establish a new poultry business by buying poultry birds. She adds that she will be running a mixed farming business, but wants to focus more on poultry due to the high turnover and ready market for the products.

She is, however, worried about the high costs of transport and and low returns for the produce.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a father of six children who are all of school-going ages. He has been in farming for ten years, producing and selling maize and vegetables to the local market. He currently employs one farmhand. He is 40 years old and works as a prison officer with the government.

Erick has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to venture into the poultry farming business. He says this will spread his farming risk and boost his farming income due to the high demand for poultry products and the good prices. He says the loan will help generate income to educate his children.

He, however, indicates the high costs of feed both in poultry and dairy farming as a great challenge.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Chhin is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school. Originally from a village located in the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common, she has been farming on her rice field as a primary business for eight years and she has supplemented her income by planting cassava for two years. She now earns more than five U.S. dollars per day from her current business. 

This is her first group loan with VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to grow more cassavas so as to earn more income and make a better living.  She wants to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Tamaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tameneh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is M'balu. M'balu is age forty-eight.  She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing with her husband and four children, one of whom is attending primary school.  M'balu has been a businesswoman for many years now.  She sells rice, ground nuts, etc.  With the help of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, ground nuts, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Joe

texts.en:
Joe is aged 40 and has been in farming in his home area of Kitale for four years.  He is married and has 3 children, between 9 and 2 years.  The first two are in school.  His farm produce of milk and eggs are sold locally.

Joe has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds for the business.  He says this will boost his poultry business and draw him closer to his target of 1000 birds on the farm.  He adds that he has the potential of being the main egg supplier in the area and wants to focus on achieving that height in five years time.  He says the income generated will improve his family living standards as well as help in repaying the loan.  He mentions rampant poultry diseases as a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, Ilgar, in Gardabani, East Georgia. Svetlana and Ilgar earn a living through agricultural activities. They own a dairy farm with six milk cows and sell milk and homemade cheese. Also, they grow broom material on a family-owned three hectares of land. Svetlana makes besom brooms and sells them at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Svetlana requested credit for purchasing up to ten calves. She will raise them during winter months and sell in late spring for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family, which will allow them to increase their spending to satisfy family needs and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase up to ten calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes and slippers for her business

loans.name: Calroline

texts.en: Calroline is 44 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has five children, ages 8 to 27.   She finished her education in 12th grade. Her husband is a health worker.  Since 2010, she has been selling rice, palm oil, and charcoal in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and charcoal for her business. She started this business with the little amount received from her husband.  She likes her business because of the way customers respond to her business.  Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha lives in the village of Dzevri, West Georgia. He is 49 years old and married. Khvicha lives with his family: his wife, Nazi, and their 19 year-old-son. Khvicha works as bread baker in a local bakery. Along with his main job, Khvicha works also on his family farm, which is the main source of income for them. The family has three dairy cows. Nazi produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris. 

Khvicha requested credit for renovation of the cattle-shed, as it is already old and can’t keep warm for the cows. After repairing the shed, cows will be in a temperature where their milking potential will increase.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for reconstruction of the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais apenas 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ela.

É negociante ha mais de 11 anos vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutros bancos e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, arroz, farinha, amendoim, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.   
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tensiona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children, only two of which still attend school. She completed 3rd grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports  three grandchildren who live with her.
She has been selling various products for over 11 years and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and has managed to repay without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as olive oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc., in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business and for that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (olive oil, rice, flour, peanuts, etc.).

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 4 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (bebidas alcoolicas, carnes e refrescos) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir  a sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has six children, four of which still attend school. She completed 4th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been in retail for over ten years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods such as alcoholic beverages, meat and refreshments in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise. The first loan was for 10.000mt, for the same purpose.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she plans to finish building and furnishing her house. For that reason she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (alcoholic beverages, meat and refreshments).

loans.name: Bo Road Group

texts.en:
