Mabinty is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mabinty was born in Magburaka town, about thirty years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has one child who is not of school-going age. Mabinty sells clothes and shoes. She has been doing this business for fifteen years now.

With the help of this loan, Mabinty and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mabinty will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy bales of clothes and dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and dozens of shoes to add to her business

loans.name: Forward Ever Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Forward Ever” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Marian is the leader of this group. The thirty-two-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have three children. Marian has been a businesswoman for 15 years now, she sells onions, rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy these items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, rice, margi, salt, sugar, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Uzbek

texts.ru: Узбек женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Жена домохозяйка. С детство он любил скот и всегда ухаживал за скотом и помогал отцу, тогда его отец занимался скотоводством. После распада СССР Узбек потерял  работу, он был механиком колхоза. Сейчас он занимается купле- продажей скота и за счет этого бизнеса содержит свою семью. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. А потом хочет сыграть свадьбу дочки, то есть выдать её замуж. Узбек запрашивает займ чтобы купить корм для скота на запас в зимний период. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Uzbek is married and is a responsible father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Uzbek has loved livestock since childhood, always took care of it and helped his father, when his father was involved in animal husbandry.  After the breakup of the USSR, Uzbek lost his job as a mechanic at a collective farm.  Currently, he is involved in buying and selling livestock and supports his family with the income from this business.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit, and then hold a wedding for his daughter, i.e. to marry her off.  Uzbek is requesting this loan to purchase animal feed for his livestock to store for the winter period.  He relies on your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed for livestock

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 34-year-old married woman with four children; all of her children are in school. She has had a business of selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akech is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beans to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Mujeres La Esperanza se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que a la Sra.Guillermina, quien contacto con una de las asesoras y de esa forma se informo y logro juntar a 13 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa de la fundación.
Guillermina, está casada, tiene 3 hijos. Nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser sandwish, empanadas, croquetas y demás, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido tener ya una clientela bien definida. Cuenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas del dia para preparar los alimentos que vende y de esa forma darle a sus clientes productos de primera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, jamón, queso y demás insumos indispensables para elaborar los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women is called "Mujeres La Esperanza." Its members live in the city of Ita.  The communal bank was started thanks to Guillermina, who contacted one of the advisors, and that way informed herself. She succeeded in bringing together 13 women, who are working very happily in the Foundation's program. 

She tell us that she sells foodstuffs of all kinds, such as sandwiches, empanadas, croquettes, and other things. It's going very well, since thanks to the good quality of her products, she has a well-established base of customers already.

She says that she gets up every day at a very early hour of the day to prepare the food she sells, and so provide her customers with first class products.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy meats, vegetables, ham, cheese and other indispensable ingredients for making the food that she sells.

loans.use: To buy meats, vegetables, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gaggawala Development Group A

texts.en:
This suave, philosophical and good-humored mother of five took the reins in her poultry business seven years ago. Unlike the many young entrepreneurs this lucrative business has spawned in recent years, Hamidah began at a time when the business was not so flourishing.

She has seen a chequered path while bearing a hand in this venture. She says it has not been easy but there have been times when her trade has basked in the glow of success. Though she says there has been a favorable turn in the tide of her business recently, she says there are still many pitfalls to overcome.

However, she says her determination and tenacity have been and will invariably be of paramount importance as her business continues on its trajectory of growth. She says she will use this loan to purchase more poultry to resell. She believes this will at length elevate her business's financial means.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to resell.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 32-year-old married woman with three children; all of them are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akech is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes to resell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush was born in 1964. She lives in Sevan with her husband and a son. Sirush graduated from college where she got a cashier qualification. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and her son is jobless.

Over eight years, Sirush has run her own business trading clothes and shoes. She rents a stall at the Sevan trade fair. She buys merchandise from Yerevan and also from Georgia and other neighboring countries. Thanks to her business, Sirush helps her husband to provide their family. 

This is Sirush’s third loan from Nor Horizon, and she has never delayed her repayments. Now, she is asking for a loan of AMD 1,000,000 to buy winter sweaters, jackets, coats and high boots for her business.

loans.use: to buy winter sweaters, jackets, coats and high boots for her business

loans.name: Maynasi

texts.en:
Maynasi is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past three years, Maynasi has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Maynasi has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Maynasi to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Maynasi hopes that in the future he will be able to increase more on his capital. 

Maynasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maynasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Tuamke - Mbangamao Group

texts.en:
Amos is a 45-year-old father of six children, with three of his children attending secondary education. He is doing well in farming activities, producing coffee, maize and beans for over five years. He is facing a lack of fertilizers, as well as crop diseases for his growing crops. 

Amos is seeking financial support to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also he is working hard to increase his scale of production from 11 to 23 acres in five years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Kuntai

texts.en:
Kuntai is 46 years old, married, and a father to five children. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past 15 years and getting good returns which have enabled him to provide for the needs of his family.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer and to buy more animals which he will fatten and sell later at a profit. He has been a good client who hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

He hopes re-invest in another business, and he believes he is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Athieng

texts.en:
Athieng is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children; three of them are in school. She has had a business selling drinks in Bor, South Sudan for five years.

Athieng is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer for sale.

loans.name: Kayiok

texts.en:
Kayiok is 32 years old and married with two children. He is a wheat farmer who has been doing this for the past nine years, and he says that the returns have been good. 

He knew about KADET from another registered client with KADET, and he joined. He has been a good client who is currently on his third loan which he plans to use to prepare land for farming and buy farm materials i.e. wheat seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming and buy farm materials

loans.name: Esther S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the leading vocational institutes in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have applied for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their institution's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment to SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Esther on the right is the leader of this group of two. She is fifty-eight years of age. A native of Magburaka town, Esther is married and has five children – two in secondary school, two in primary and one in college. Esther has been a teacher for thirty-two years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy bags of cements and nails for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy bags of cements and nails for the construction of a house

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Маърифат  1963 года рождения, муж 12 лет назад уехал на заработки в Россию  и без вести пропал. Маърифат одна сама воспитала своих детей.  У нее 3 детей: 2 сыновей и дочь. Работает она в поликлинике старшей медсестрой. Работает там она в течении 5 лет. Её старший сын  работает на стройке , делает ремонт помещений. Другой её сын находиться в России и ежемесячно присылает ей деньги. Это ее первый кредит в нашей организации. Этот кредит на хочет приобрести колыбель и подарков для внука. По нашей традиции она как бабушка должна накупит много игрушек и одежды. Её внуку сделают обрезание и проведут свадьбу. Она планирует  после погашения еще получить кредит на ремонт дома.  Сейчас она благодарна  нашей организации за поддержку.
texts.en: Marifat was born in 1963.  Her husband left to go to Russia for work twelve years ago and went missing.  Marifat raised her children alone.  She has three children: two sons and a daughter.  She works as a senior nurse at a hospital and has been working there for five years.  Her oldest son works at a construction site and repairs buildings.  Her other son is in Russia and sends her money monthly.  This is Marifat's first loan with our organization.  She wants to use this loan to purchase a crib and gifts for her grandson.  According to our tradition, she, as the grandmother, has to purchase many toys and clothing.  They will hold a circumcision ceremony for her grandson and hold a wedding.  Marifat plans to obtain another loan for home repair after repaying this loan.  Now, she is grateful to our organization for support.

loans.use: to purchase a crib and gfts for her grandson

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza se formo por medio de que algunas integrantes que ya estaban dentro del programa de comité, decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad. De esa manera comienza el comité que actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Fatima es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo hace ya un buen tiempo, gracias a su sacrificio y a su buen toque para las ventas ha podido crecer y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella desea seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, el cual invertirá en la compra de prendas, las cuales volverá a vender. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
"La Esperanza" communal bank was formed by a few members who were already in the communal bank program. They decided to form one within their community. That's how the communal bank was formed, that is currently in its first loan cycle with the program. They came together with the aim of working together, and through that work, helping their families. 

Fatima is one of the members. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She tells us that she has been selling clothing of all kinds for some time now. Thanks to her sacrifice and her good sales touch, she has been able to grow, and that way help her family. 

She wishes to continue growing, and that's why she is applying for the loan. She will use it to buy articles of clothing, that she will then sell.

She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are providing her.

loans.use: To buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 35-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in the school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Martha is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида замужняя женщина средних лет, имеет троих детей, работает в комбинате благоустройства - уличным дворником. Имеет большой стаж работы, но семейные условия среднее. После информирования со стороны родственников, которые кредитуются в нашей организации, очень обрадовалась о нашем существовании, так как на покупку чего-то у них нет наличных денег. Сыновья Саиды уже взрослые и сами уже зарабатывают, и обязуются помочь в погашении кредита. На кредит собирается купить холодильник и обставить кухню.
texts.en: Saida is a married, middle-age woman, who has three children and works as a street janitor for the improvements plant.  She has an extensive work experience, but her family conditions are average.  After being informed by her relatives, who obtain financing from our organization, Saida was happy to find out about our existence because she does not have available cash for any purchases.  Saida's sons are already grown and earn their own money, and promise to help with repaying this loan.  Saida plans to use this loan to purchase a refrigerator and furnish her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mikael

texts.en:
Mikael is a 26-year-old single gentleman. He is a maize farmer, and he has been for the past eight years. 

He knew about KADET from another registered client with KADET. He has been a good client, and this is his third loan which he plans to use to prepare land for farming and buy farm materials, i.e. maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: To prepare land for farming and buy farm materials (i.e. maize seeds and fertilizers)

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Рачабхола - многодетная женщина на пенсии, живет в горном районе, где основным делом и бизнесом является животноводство. Вся семья - невестки,сыновья и внуки помогают присматривать за скотом. Муж на пенсии, подрабатывает на колхозе и немного поддерживает семейный бюджет. Кроме откорма скота женщины прядут пряжу из шерсти своих коз и вяжут носки и изделия на продажу. За период кредитования у нас увеличила свой скот, немного улучшила состояние дома. Женила сына и наш кредит ей очень помог, за что благодарна и планирует с нами работать и дальше. На запрашиваемый кредит собирается прикупить мелкий скот.
texts.en: Rajabhola is a retired woman, who has many children and lives in a mountainous district, where animal husbandry is the primary type of work and business.  The entire family - daughters-in-law, sons and grandsons - help to look after the livestock.  Rajab's husband is also a retiree.  He works part-time at a collective farm and supports the family budget somewhat.  Besides feeding livestock, the women spin yarn from their goats' wool and knit socks and other goods for sale.  Over the period of obtaining financing with us, Rajab increased her livestock headcount and somewhat improved her housing conditions.  She married off her son, and our loan helped her a lot, for which she is grateful and plans to continue working with us.  She plans to use this loan to purchase small livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Gloría tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella es de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Esta señora es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanía así como frazada, manteles y otros, pero también aparte de eso se dedica a la venta de bebidas y posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en su domicilio. Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo hacerse de casa propia y adquirir las comodidades necesarias para sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer frazadas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, ya que son más económicos en este tiempo y ella tiene mucha demanda. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Gloría is 38, and a single mother with two school-age children. She is from the city of Carapeguá. This woman is very enterprising and hard-working. She  makes and sells handicrafts, such as blankets, tablecloths and other things. 

Besides that, she also sells beverages, and has a small grocery store that she runs in her home. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she managed to get her own house, and acquire the necessary comforts for her children.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy thread and dye for weaving the blankets that her customers ask for at this time of year. They are cheaper right now, and she has a lot of demand. She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: To buy thread and dye for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is 40 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by another registered client in his abode. This is his third loan which he plans to use to purchase farm materials, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also animals (cows and goats) for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plough back into farming and parts to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher level of education. He believes that he is a hard-working man who can achieve a lot more with financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 32-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Ajah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more firewood

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La Sra. Daniela es de Ciudad del Este, está casada y tiene dos hijos, todos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en Hernandarias, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, ya que tratan de ayudarse como familia, para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan salir adelante y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta.
Acude una vez más a la fundación para la compra de lácteos, bebidas, comestibles, hortalizas y demás tipos de insumos con lo cual quiere abastecer su negocio, para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniela is from Ciudad del Este.  She is married and has two grown children.  She has a small store in Hernandarias whose sales are ever on the rise that generates good income for her.

She tells us that, with the help of her husband and her whole family, they are getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  They try to help each other out like family so that through their work together they can get ahead and achieve a better lifestyle.

She is currently a successful small businesswoman with a large, loyal clientele, thanks to her kindness.

She has proven to be a responsible and honest person.

She is coming to the foundation once again to buy dairy products, drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and other kinds of products to stock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a businesslady who sells shoes in the Mombasa area. She is single, and she has been operating this business for the last year, getting good profits. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers, and this marks her first loan to help her expand her business. She plans to buy more varieties of shoes as stock as she plans to cash in during the festive season. She plans to use the anticipated profits to build her capital. 

She hopes in future to realize more profits from her business and expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of shoes

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a 37-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of  three and 18. Three of them go to school. 

Zainabu runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for six years. She has no employees. Zainabu heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of SDG 2,500 to purchase more food items like onions, cooking oil, beans and many others. Zainabu has no source of income other than this business.

In five years time, Zainabu would like to hope for an increase in the business size and to have a good store.

Her major challenges include issues of school fees and home expenses. 

Zainabu says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like onions, cooking oil, beans and many others

loans.name: Livingston

texts.en:
Livingston is 50 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kamala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Livingston has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Livingston has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale and will help Livingston to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Livingston hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Livingston is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Livingston who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap

loans.name: Guarani - Ka’Aguy Group

texts.es:
El comité “Guarani – Ka’aguy” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la Ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto, para que de esa forma sirvan de ayuda, no solo para ellas mismas sino también para sus familias. Ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Francisca, quien se dedica al macate(venta ambulante) de frazadas, sabanas, ollas y demás tipos de productos. Ella comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias para ofrecer sus productos, pero nos cuenta que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honrado.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás productos, con lo que tendrá más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee, "Guarani-Ka'aguy" was created by several female neighbors in the city of Santaní.  All of the members partake in independent activities but they also have some that they do together with the intention of helping not only themselves but also their families.  They have formed a very united and capable group that have strengthened their friendship through the accomplishment of projects together.  

One of the members is Francisca, who is a vendor of blankets, sheets, pots, and other products.  She comments that she sacrifices a lot for her job since she needs to cover long distances in order to sell her products.  However, she tells us that she is very proud of what she does since it's a dignified and honorable job.  She is seeking a loan from this foundation and from Kiva so that she may purchase sheets, blankets, and other products in order to have more variety to offer to her clients.

loans.use: purchase blankets, sheets, and other products to be sold.

loans.name: Gaggawala 'b' Dev't Group B

texts.en:
Warm-hearted Aida plys her general merchandise retail business in Kampala.  The mother of five sells a variety of commodities, to wit, sugar, maize flour, plastics, beans, rice. etc.

She has now been in this business for a decade. Weekly, she says her sales returns sum up to UGX 100,000.

She says the thought of expansion weighs heavily on her mind and the odds of expanding her business in the near future are ten to one. Aida says she will use her Kiva loan to purchase more retail items, such as maize flour, soap, salt, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail items, such as maize flour, soap, salt, rice, etc. to resell

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 24-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children, ages one and four. Neither of them goes to school. 

For one year, Faiza has run a small hotel business. She has no employees. Faiza heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach, and promotion by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 500 to purchase cassava flour, meat, beans and many other food items. Apart from this business, Faiza has no other source of income.

In five years, Faiza would like to enlarge her her small hotel.

Her home expenses are a major challenge.

Faiza says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support of helping her with some capital for supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as cassava flour, meat, and beans.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con el objetivo de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de cada una de ellas. Ven en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda que en otros lugares no han podido encontrar. Desean llegar al máximo nivel del programa por lo que diariamente se esfuerzan.
Una de esas mujeres trabajadoras es Alejandra, quien se dedica a la venta de leche. Comenta que todos los dias empieza a trabajar a muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene que dejarle a sus clientes muy temprano la leche en sus respectivas casas. Dice que su trabajo es muy agotador, pero le gusta mucho. Gracias a su sacrificio ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, lo cual la ayudara a abastecerse para no quedarse sin stock, para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sixteen hard-working and strong women from the city of San Lorenzo has united with the objective of using their jobs to move them ahead.  They see that the foundation's program offers them a great help that they would not be able to find elsewhere.  They work hard every day so that they can try to reach the highest level of the program.  

One of these hard-working women is Alejandra, who sells milk for a living.  She comments that every day she goes to work very early since she needs to deliver milk to her clients' houses in the early hours of the morning.  She says that her job is very stressful but she enjoys it.  Thanks to her sacrifice, she has been able to provide for her family and get them ahead.  She is asking for this credit so that she may purchase a greater quantity of milk which would keep help her inventory well-stocked.  This will allow her to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: purchase milk for future sales.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 34-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 15 and 5.  Three of them go to school. 

Joyce runs a food store and has been in the business for 4 years. She has no employees. Joyce heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach, and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking a loan of SDG 2000 to purchase more food items like onions, green pepper, Irish potatoes, and many others. Besides this business, Joyce has no other sources of income.

In 5 years time, Joyce hopes to increase her business and make it better.

Her major challenges include issues with home expenses and school fees. 

Joyce says that she is grateful for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like onions, green peppers, Irish potatoes, and many others

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Lized

texts.es: La Sra. Lized  se dedica a la venta de verduras variadas los días de feria miércoles y sábados estos días son donde tiene bastante demanda de sus productos la señora sale muy temprano desde las 4 de la mañana donde adquiere los productos directamente de los productores   y posteriormente los comercializa en una calle muy populosa de la ciudad de Cochabamba de forma ambulante indica que tiene experiencia de 6 años en esta actividad; con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería en verduras al por mayor,  vive en casa propia en la zona Sud una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su familia esta conformada por su conyugue  que se encuentra trabajando en Argentina y sus 2 hijos los cuales aun son pequeños se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, la señora indica que esta actividad le permite mantener a su familia por lo que agradece la confianza en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Señora Lized makes a living selling a variety of vegetables on Wednesdays and Saturdays at the market.  There is a high demand for her products on these days, so she leaves very early in the morning, at 4am, to acquire the products directly from the producers and then sell them on a very popular street in the city of Cochabamba.  She has had over 6 years of experience in this line of work.  With this credit, she hopes to purchase vegetables at whole sale.  She lives in her own home in the Sud region, a semi-urban part of the city of Cochabamba.  Her family consists of her spouse, who works in Argentina, and her two young children who are studying in school.  Lized states that this job allows her to support her family so she is grateful for the trust given to her by offering her credit.

loans.use: increase her capital to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Awaggwa Eku Kirinya Development Group

texts.en:
"Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand." ~George Eliot (Silas Marner)

Well, this statement sums up the expectations 35-year-old Harriet has for the future expansion of her tailoring business.
The only secret to success based on this mother-of-one's estimation is unwavering diligence and a sense of purpose. She says all bets are off on the growth and expansion of her business.
Thus far, her business enjoys sales returns to the tune of UGX 160,000 monthly.
She says this Kiva loan will help her with the purchase of more textiles for clothes making.

loans.use: to purchase more textiles for clothes making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor for his vehicle that he uses to transport passengers.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro nació en la Ciudad de Sucre tiene cinco hijos algunos ya mayores y otros pequeños, convive con la Sra. Reimunda ella es ama de casa ya que tiene que cuidad a sus hijos, viven  en la planchada distante a 28 km de del Torno, donde viven y trabajan, en la agricultura, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, maní, sandia y también se dedica a la ganadería, el Sr. Pedro trabaja con toda su familia, sus hijos le ayudan en lo que es la siembra y la comercialización, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y también en el preparado de la tierra para la siembra, el ya viene trabajando hace cinco secuencias con emprender por lo cual el manifiesta que se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que la institución le ha venido dando, para mejorar su calidad de vida. En la foto el Sr. Pedro se encuentra acompañado de su hijo.
texts.en: Pedro was born in the city of Sucre.  He has five children, some old and some young.  He lives with Reimunda, who is a housewife that cares for their children.  They live and work 28km from Torno.  They work in agriculture, specifically in the sowing of corn, peanuts, watermelon, and also the raising of livestock.  Pedro works with his entire family.  His children help him with the sowing and the commercialization.  The money from this credit will help him purchase seeds that he needs to sow the corn and also to prepare the soil.  He has been a member of this institution for over five cycles and is very grateful for the help that they have given him to help him improve his quality of life.  In this picture, Pedro is accompanied by one of his sons.

loans.use: purchase seeds for corn sowing.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros, quien se informo acerca del programa de la fundación paraguaya y decidió agrupar a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surgió el comité. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. María es la presidenta del comité y se dedica a la compra-venta de aceites así como también en su tiempo libre se dedica al reciclaje; por supuesto se preocupada por su grupo y siempre trata de cumplir con todo lo exigido por la Fundación. Ella comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles las mínimas comodidades para tener una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de aceites para después volverlos a vender. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members who learned of the Paraguayan Foundation's program and decided to get her female friends and neighbors together to create this group.  They are all hardworking and strong women that want to get ahead and help their families.  

Maria is the president of this committee and works in the buying and selling of oil.  She also works in recycling in her free time.  She worries about her group and always tries to fulfill all that is asked of her by the Foundation.  She comments that thanks to her efforts, she has been able to help her family and give them certain comforts that make their lives more dignified and respectable.  She is asking for this credit so that she may purchase oils that she will then re-sell.  She appreciates the Foundation for the opportunities that it gives them.

loans.use: purchase oil to be sold in the future.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is a 43-year-old businesswoman living in Juba. She is married and has 5 children. They are between the ages of 4 and 18 and all of them go to school. 

Poni has been running a Tea business for 4 years and has 2 employees. This business is Poni's only source of income. Poni would like to expand her business into a hotel in the next five years. She would like to take a loan of 2,500 SDG in order to purchase items for her tea business, such as milk, flasks, chairs and tables.

Her major challenges include school fees and home expenses. Poni heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach and the promotion done by the loan officers. Poni hopes that God will bless Finance Sudan to continue in South Sudan with this program.

loans.use: to purchase items for her tea business, such as milk, flasks, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy es comerciante de calzados de niños. El crédito que requiere  es para compra de más calzados y así poder surtir su stock para  aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año. Nancy es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Nancy es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006, con 11 créditos concedidos durante todos estos años y pagados en forma excelente. Esta vez ella ha decidido que su aplicación sea enviada a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a merchant who sells children’s shoes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more shoes so that she can replenish her stock and take advantage of the year-end festivities. Nancy is a widow and has three children. She lives in her own home in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz.

Nancy has been a client of IMPRO since 2006. She has received 11 loans throughout this entire time and has repaid them in an excellent manner. This time she decided that her application would be sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase children's shoes to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Maria de Jesús con sus amigas cristina, Santos Nicolasa, Elsa cristina, Emperatriz, Alba Rosa, Cerafina, Maryeni , Lidia y Guillermina  conforman el banco solidario   Rosa de Saron, todas con un objetivo  que cumplir.  Serafina  se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno. Esta Mujer es mayor de edad pero es muy responsable y honrada .Cerafina  aprendió  desde que era niña a  elaborar la cosa de horno con ayuda de sus padres. Ella quiere el crédito para comprar aceite, leña, maíz, cuajada, azúcar y así poder realizar su  sueño. Estas mujeres que conforman el banco comunal necesitan su crédito para la compra de sus productos y trabajar todos los días.
texts.en: Maria de Jesus and her friends, Cristina, Santos Nicolasa, Elsa Cristina, Emperatriz, Alba Rosa, Cerafina, Maryeni, Lidia, and Guillermina make up the Rosa de Saron Communal Bank and they all have a goal to reach.  Serafina sells cosa de horno, a Nicaraguan dessert, for a living.  She is a senior citizen, but she is very responsible and honest.  Serafina learned how to make cosa de horno when she was a little girl, with the help of her parents.  She wants this loan to buy oil, firewood, corn, curd, and sugar to be able to make her dream a reality.  The women who make up this communal bank need their loans to buy their products and work every day.

loans.use: to buy oil, firewood, corn, curd, and sugar.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old businesswoman who is married. For the last eleven years, she has had a business selling clothing in the Mombasa area. Jane has been doing well in her business. 

Jane was introduced to KADET by one of our staff. This marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more bales of clothes for her stock. She hopes to realize more profits and build on her capital so she will be able to expand her business

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Flor De Lipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LIPE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cristina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de agricultura, comercio de sogas, comercio de verduras.

La señora Cristina  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de pitas y sogas que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de pitas y sogas) que comprará de Desaguadero y lo comercializa en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank “FLOR DE LIP” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center. It is made up of eight members and led by a committee which is headed by a woman named Cristina. The businesses that the members of the association bring forward are varied, including: agricultural production, rope sales, and vegetable trade. 

Cristina says that it is the first time that she has been a part of Pro Mujer, to which she was invited as part of a promotion. Right now she has a business selling twine and rope, which she has been doing for years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise (to purchase twin and rope) that she will buy in Desaguadero and sell in street markets. This type of job lets her make money, which allows her to support her family. She is married and has five children.

What they asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy twine and rope.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo es artesano costurero; confecciona ropa y hace reparaciones en general. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial. Pablo es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Luís de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta será la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is a sewing artisan who produces clothing and makes general alterations. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine. Pablo is married and has one child. He lives at the home of his in-laws in the District of San Luís in the city of El Alto.

This is the second time that his loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 37-year-old woman who is married and a mother of two beautiful children. Her husband has a transport business and supports the family financially. Milka is a hairdresser who operates a salon and cosmetic shop. She has been in this business for three years, with a monthly income of 27,500 KS.

This will be Milka‘s third loan with KADET LTD. She has repaid all other loans successfully. With this loan she wants to buy beauty products for another cosmetic shop she is opening in a different town so that she can maximize on the profits. In the future she wants to be a successful businesswoman in Limuru.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for another cosmetic shop she is opening

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre La Alegría se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, donde todas las integrantes trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa, para que de esa forma puedan alcanzar sus objetivos. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo.
La Sra.Silvia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, comenta que siempre tiene muchos clientes pues sus comidas son muy apreciadas por sus clientes. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que no tiene miedo al trabajo, dice que su meta principal es seguir creciendo cada día más y más.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en los ingredientes que utiliza para elaborar sus comidas y así surtir más variedades de alimentos y de esta manera también mejorar su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía en su hogar esta mejorando bastante.
texts.en:
The Alegría Women’s Committee is in its first loan cycle with the Foundation’s women entrepreneurs program. In this program all the members work together collectively so they can reach their objectives. Each woman works independently but also helps develop activities with the other members to collect funds as working capital for the group.

Sra. Silvia is a member of the group. She earns her living selling food. She always has a lot of customers because her food is much appreciated. Silvia is known as a hardworking enterprising woman who is not afraid of work. Her principal goal is to continue growing her business as each day passes. 

Silvia is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for the food she makes and as well to add to her supplies so she can make a greater variety of dishes. As a result she will increase her income and improve her standard of living. Silvia says that her household is greatly benefitting from the income from her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food such as meat, vegetables, condiments etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en: Kezia is an older woman who is in the business of buying and selling clothes and blankets in Gweru. She once got a loan and managed to pay it back without any problem. With the previous loan, Kezia managed to improve her profitability and efficiency but the amount was still not enough. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase more goods and thereby increase her rate of turnover for maximization of profits. With this loan, Kezia will also help change significantly the standard of living of her family. She is hopeful that in the next five years she will be able to achieve her dream of owning her own shop and providing employment for the unemployed populace in her community.

loans.use: To buy jeans, skirts, boots, tops, and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is single  

George has been running a drugstore for 3 years. He has 1 employee. George heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach and promotion by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 to purchase more drugs and other items. George has no other source of income.

In 5 years time, George would like to expand his drug store. 

His major challenges include low income for adding stock. 

George says that, if God blesses Finance Sudan to continue in South Sudan, there will be a future for them.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 26-year-old tailor. She is single and has been in this business for the past six years. She says that she is able to meet all her expenses and business needs as she is doing great. 

Everlyne was introduced to KADET by another existing client and this is her first loan to help expand her business. She plans to purchase more material and thread for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her KADET loan as a well as to put aside some savings. 

She hopes to have a successful business and family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more material and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and wheat flour

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 25-year-old married business woman who operates a salon in Mombasa. She has been running this business for the last four years, and she is doing very well. 

Lilian was introduced to KADET by one of our credit staff, and this is her first time borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase dryers, blow-dryers, towels, and hair chemicals for the salon. 

Lilian will use her anticipated profits to add more stock. She hopes to realize additional profits and to be able to expand her business even further.

loans.use: to purchase dryers, blow dryers, towels, and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married and has seven children ages 7 to 30. She stopped her education in sixth grade. 

Since 2010, Martha has been selling groundnut and palm oil. She started this business with a small amount that she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. 

Martha's plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Nagham

texts.en:
Nagham ia a 29-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and three children, who are in school. Her husband, who has worked on his own as a blacksmith since 1986, is the main income provider in the family. As for Nagham, she works under pressure and doesn’t hesitate to show help whenever the family needs it. 

Nagham has owned a mini market for the past two years and has succeeded at work, especially because she is very welcoming and friendly. She is  requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products and to increase her inventory of goods and provisions, in order to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open a fast food snack stand next to her mini market.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products and increase her inventory of goods and provisions.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 31-year-old business lady who deals with the sale of clothes, handbags and shoes in Mombasa town. She is single and has been running this business for the past two years, and she is doing great in the business. 

She was introduced to KADET by another client and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of handbags, shoes and clothes so as to cash in during the Christmas festive season. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and hopes to realize more profits and be stable in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of handbags, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi is married. He has 5 children. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor cost and to buy seeds and fertilizers for rice production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica a la confección y venta de mandiles (aprons in english) su esposo trabaja en provincia en la venta de ganado. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de maquina de coser industrial para su mejor terminado en sus trabajos. Virginia   es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Rosas Pampa  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y por el carácter social del mismo Virginia solicita que sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia produces and sells aprons. Her husband works in the province by selling cattle. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine so that she can do a better job of completing her orders. Virginia is married and has five children. She lives at her parents’ house in the District of Rosas Pampa in the city of El Alto.

This is the first time she is requesting a loan. Because of Virginia’s social character, her loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine for making aprons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, salt and maize flour.

loans.name: Ligia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Ligia Antonia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de granos básicos desde hace 5 meses aproximadamente. Ella inicio este negocio ya que vio la necesidad que había en la comunidad de una pequeña venta y con ayuda de su madre invirtió en unos cuantos productos.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un Frízer para así comprar pollo y carnes, leche, queso, mantequilla, mortadela para el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ligia Antonia is a hardworking enterprising woman who has been selling basics for approximately five months now. She began the business when she saw the need in her community for a small business selling these items. With help from her mother she bought a few products. 

Ligia will use the loan money to buy a freezer for the business and stock it with chicken, meat, milk, cheese, butter, and bologna.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock it with products needing refrigeration

loans.name: Dut

texts.en: Dut is a 28-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is single. He runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 2 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more items like milk, biscuits, cigarettes and many others. He has no other source of income in addition to this business. His major challenges include competitors only. He says that he is appreciating Finance Sudan for considering low income earners by giving them loans to support their business. In 5 years time, he would like to hope for a better future, like having a good house.

loans.use: to purchase more items like milk, biscuits, cigarettes etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 32-year-old mirror hawker in Voi. He is single and has been in the business for the past ten years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers and this marks his first borrowing to enable him to expand his business. He plans to purchase more stock of mirrors and use the anticipated profits to repay his KADET loan and be able to have a permanent shop for his mirrors. He hopes to have a big and more profitable business and a happy, satisfied family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of mirrors.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is married with 6 children. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 5 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 7. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is married with 4 children. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a 50-year-old hotel owner in Mariakani area. She is a married mother of six children and has been in this business for the past eleven years. She says that the business is doing great, and she is able to cater to her family's needs. 

Nzingo was introduced to KADET by another client, and this marks her first time borrowing to expand her business. She plans to purchase more stock of assorted foodstuffs such as beans, maize flour, and cooking oils for her hotel. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her KADET loan. She dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of assorted foodstuffs such as beans, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Libertaha

texts.en:
Libertaha is married and has two children, all of whom attend school. She has been a rice farmer for 12 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs, and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production time.
 
With the profits from her farming, Libertaha wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es: El señor Lucho es artesano zapatero y se dedica a la confección  y reparación de zapatos. Lucho tiene contratos para entregar cuatro docenas de zapatos en forma semanal. El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda, pues necesita cementar el patio y su casa necesita ser pintada. Lucho es casado y tiene cuatro  hijos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en: Sr. Lucho is a seasoned shoemaker.  He produces and repairs shoes.  Lucho has contracts in which he must deliver four dozen shoes on a weekly basis.  The loan he is requesting will be used for home improvements.  He needs to apply cement on his patio and his house needs to be painted.  Lucho is married and has four children.  He lives in his own home in the District of Río Seco in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing his patio and painting his house.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is married and has one 4-year-old child. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs, and to buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production time. 

With profits the from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and married.  He lives in Mombasa. He is a bureau owner and his business has been in operation for one year with good returns.

Joseph is requesting his first loan, which he will use to purchase printers, computers and photocopiers for his bureau business. Joseph was introduced to KADET by other clients. He will use the anticipated profits to build capital and hopes to realize more profits in the future for further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase printers, computers, and photocopiers for his business.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gadi, a married father of a three-year-old, has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy seeds and fertilizers during rice production. With profits from his enterprise, in the future Gadi wishes to acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre, the married father of a six-year-old, has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He will use this Kiva loan to pay labor costs during rice production and to purchase fertilizer and seeds to increase production. With profits from his enterprise, Sylvestre wishes to eventually acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor support.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi, a 41-year-old single mother of five children, has been a greengrocer in Mombasa town for the past four years. Her business is doing well, allowing her to meet the needs of her family.

Mwanaharusi was recently introduced to KADET by one of our staff, and this marks her first loan with which she plans to purchase more cabbages, kale, carrots, onions and tomatoes to increase her stock. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her standard of living, and hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, kale, carrots, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more herbs for his clinic.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 24 year old businessman who operates a video shop and also keeps livestock in the Mariakani area. He is single and has been operating these businesses for the last 4 years with great returns.

He was introduced to KADET by another client in his area of residence, and this marks his first time borrowing to finance his business. He plans to use the loan to purchase new movies, DVDs and video games for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and repay his KADET loan. 

He hopes to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase new movies, DVDs and video games.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a 49 year old fish monger and livestock keeper in Mariakani. She is a married mother of three children and has been in this business for the past seven years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our credit staff and this marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more fish for sale in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

She hopes to purchase a piece of land from the accumulated profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 31-year-old second-hand clothes hawker in Mombasa town. She is married and the mother of two children. She has been operating this business for the past ten years. She confesses that she is doing great as she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

Teresia was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more bales of clothes for her business and use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

She hopes to own a clothes store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 31-year-old food vendor in Mombasa. She is married .she has been cooking and selling food  for the past five years. 

She was introduced to KADET by another kadet customer and this marks her first borrowing to expand her business. She plans to purchase more maize flour and cooking oil for cooking in her food vending business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and hopes to realize more profits to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase stock of  maize flour and cooking oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Vanessa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 38 años de edad quien se dedica al comercio de lencería (blúmeres, brasieres, hilos, tangas…etc.). Ella inicio este negocio hace 3 años con pocos productos pero con mucho deseo de salir adelante,  trabajo y su mayor motivación son sus tres hijos para los cuales es madre y padre. 
  El crédito lo invertirá en adquirir mercadería para el negocio en especial por las fechas.
texts.en:
38-year old Sra. Claudia Vanessa is a hardworking enterprising woman who earns her living selling underwear such as panties, bras, thongs, and lingerie. She started the business three years ago with just a few products, but she worked hard as she was very keen to get ahead. Her main motivation is her three children for whom she is both mother and father.

Claudia will use the loan money to buy more merchandise for her business especially speciality items for special days.

loans.use: to buy more lingerie

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 55-year-old poultry farmer who also sells clothes in the Mombasa area. She is married and has been in this business for the past 11 years. She says that the businesses are great but she needs a bit of capital injection to expand.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and this marks her first borrowing to expand her business. She plans to purchase more bales of clothes for her stock to supplement her income. 

She will use the anticipated profits to build her capital and hopes to realize more profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: San Pedro De Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN PEDRO DE HUATAJATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Gaby es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra de animales, comercio de charque, venta de cerveza, venta de pescado, venta de ganado, venta de chompas, venta de verduras.

La señora Gaby,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. “San Pedro de Huatajata” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana center.  The group is made up of 12 people and is run by a Board with Gaby as the treasurer.  The group has different types of businesses such as: buying animals, jerky sales,  beer sales, fish sales, cattle sales, sweater sales and vegetables sales.  

Gaby says that this is the first cycle that she will work with Pro Mujer and she joined the institution after having received an invitation from a “promotora” (a trained community worker).   She currently has a business of selling vegetables that she has had for years and that she learned from her aunt.

She will use the loan to increase her working capital (buying vegetables) that she will purchase in La Ceja and later sell in the village market.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is single.

When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the financing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more basins, iron boxes and washing powders for his business.

loans.name: Cinthia Yanet

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia, nació  Santa Cruz, tiene 25 años de edad, ella se dedica  ala agricultura, convive con el Sr. Yerson tienen dos hijos pequeños, tiene su parcela en Pampa del Coscal distante a 32km  de el Torno, donde vive y trabaja en la  agricultura, es su segunda secuencia que viene trabajando con la institución, el crédito que ha solicitado es para la compra de semillas para  la siembra de maíz y cosecha de maní, todo lo que siembra lo comercializa en el mercado de la localidad, la Sra. Cinthia  Nos manifiesta que se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la confianza depositada en ella, en la foto la Sra. Cinthia se encuentra con su esposo, que también colabora con ella en la agricultura, ambos trabajan duro para darle un futuro mejor a su familia .
texts.en:
Cinthia, who was born in Santa Cruz, is 25 years old and dedicated to farming. She lives with her husband, Yerson, and their 2 small children. Cinthia has a parcel of land in Pampa del Coscal, some 32 kilimeters from El Torno, where she lives and works in agriculture.

This is the 2nd time Cinthia has worked with our institution. The loan she solicits is for buying seeds to sow corn and, also, for harvesting peanuts. All that she harvests, she sells in her local market. Cinthia expresses her gratitude for the confidence that our institution has placed in her.

In the photo, Cinthia appears with her husband who collaborates with her in farming. They both work hard to provide a better future for their family.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sow corn, and for harvesting peanuts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 40-year-old business lady who deals in the sale of toys and belts in Mombasa. She is married and has been running this business for the past 11 years. 

Ruth was introduced to KADET by other clients and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more stock of assorted belts and toys for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to build capital for the business.
 
She hopes to realize more profits and be able to expand the business even further.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted belts and toys.

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis is a 50-year-old dairy farmer in the Mariakani area. He is a married father of four children who has been doing this business for the last ten years and he is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase feed for his cattle and use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

He hopes to lead a good, settled life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 41 años es una mujer casada con Florian de 44 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 18 y 3 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Kivinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Teodora es una madre luchadora, que trabaja desde temprano. Se dedica con mayor tiempo a la agricultura. Cuenta con terrenos de cultivos en su comunidad, ahí siembra cítricos como naranjas y mandarinas. Así como café de cuya cosecha anual obtiene buenas ganancias.
La cosecha de sus productos las traslada hacia la ciudad de Yurinaki, donde tiene compradores fijos.
Del mismo modo trabaja como promotora de alfabetización en pueblos lejanos de su zona. Esto como un programa del estado para lo cual debe capacitarse constantemente. En ambas actividades le va bien. Como promotora recibe una remuneración mensual, mientras que en el campo es anual o semestral pero las ganancias son considerables.
Esta mujer espera ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos con más café. Para ello arrendará parcelas. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por ello se siente segura de que pagará puntualmente las cuotas. Muestra alegría al mencionar que pertenece al banco comunal “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”, por que tiene muchos planes con el grupo.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para una nueva plantación de café.
texts.en:
Teodora, age 41, is married to Florian, age 44. They have 2 children, ages 18 and 3. They live in their own house in the settlement of Kivinake, Chanchamayo Province.

Teodora is an enterprising mother who works from early in the day. She spends most of her time farming. She has land in her community, and there she plants citrus crops such as oranges and tangerines, as well as coffee from whose annual harvest she obtains good earnings.

Her harvested produce is transported to the city of Yurinake where she has established buyers. She also works promoting literacy in distant towns in her area.
