This is a state program for which she must qualify herself constantly. She is doing well in both of these activities. As an educator she receives monthly compensation while her compensation for farm work is annual or semi-annual, but the earnings are respectable. This woman wants to increase her land under cultivation for coffee. That’s why she will rent parcels.

This would be her first loan from MFP. She feels certain that she will pay her installments on time. She is happy to say that she belongs to the “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki” (Little Seeds of Kivinaki) communal bank because she has a lot of plans with the group. With the loan money she will be able to buy bags of fertilizer for a new coffee plantation.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old fish monger in Mombasa, married mother of six children and has been operating this business for the last two years. The business is doing great. 

Since Jane was introduced to KADET this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use the funds to purchase more fish stocks for her business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and hopes to own a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to add to her stock .

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia es cosmetóloga de profesión y ella trabaja en un centro muy conocido y a unas cuadras del centro de la ciudad de Cusco; La socia desea en esta ocasión invertir su crédito en la compra de peines, secadora de cabello y otros pequeños accesorios para uso en el salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una secadora, peines, y otros pequeños accesorios para el salón de belleza.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the LOS ANGELES communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Cusco Province, department of Cusco.

The member is 37 years old and has a common law husband. She has 2 children. The member is a beautician by profession, and she works in a very well known shopping center a few blocks from the center of the city of Cusco. On this occasion, she wants to invest her loan in the purchase of combs, a hair dryer, and other small accessories for her beauty salon. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, combs, and other small accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo gracias al esfuerzo de una de las miembros, quien con las ganas de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas se informo y les motivo a formar el comité. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras, quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio luchan por sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Blanca, quien se dedica a las ventas. Nos comenta que vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sábanas y demás artículos, en lo cual le va muy bien, porque ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compran de ella. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus productos. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy emprendedora.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás artículos para la posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le están dando.
texts.en: This group was formed thanks to the effort of one of its members, who with the desire to help her friends and neighbors, became informed [about the loan process] and this motivated her to form the commitee.  They are hard-working, determined, and very enterprising women, who with a lot of effort and sacrifice fight for their families.  One of the members is Blanca, who works in sales.  She informs us that she sells all types of products, such as blankets, sheets, and other articles, and that it is going very well for her because she already has well-defined customers who always buy from her.  One of her dreams to to be able to have her own place where she could offer her products.  She describes herself as a determined, hard-working, and very enterprising woman.  She requests the loan in order to purchase blankets, sheets, and other articles to later sell.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and sheets to then sell.

loans.name: Huexca Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Huexca Santa Cruz está conformado por las señoras Alicia, Maricela, Eliza van a comprar con su crédito borregos para crianza, la señora Gloria va a comprar pulseras y anillos de oro, el señor Rodolfo va a comprar becerros, la señora Socorro va a comprar leche para preparar queso y crema, la señora Alejandra va a comprar huevo, leche y refrescos, la señora Roció va a comprar fertilizantes, la señora María del Socorro va a comprar maíz, carnes, jitomate, tomates, cebolla, chiles para preparar tlacoyos y tortas. La señora Maricela tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 varones y 1 mujer, los dos más pequeños están estudiando la secundaria, ella vende borregos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar sorgo, maíz, milpa para alimentar a sus borregos, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años su esposo la animo en este negocio lo iniciaron con lo que le dieron de la venta del sorgo, en esta comunidad la mayoría se dedican a la ganadería, los borregos los tiene en el campo, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para la comida, para volver a invertir, de ahí toma los borregos para la fiestas de sus hijos, a ella le gusta ver que los borregos van creciendo y se siente orgullosa ver que sus hijos le ayudan en la crianza van en la tarde a pastorear los borregos. Sus sueños y esperanzas que su negocio siga creciendo, construir un cuartito para recamara de su hija y que sus hijos más pequeños sigan estudiando. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos, por confiar en nosotros, vamos a cumpliren los pagos y esperamos que nos sigan apoyando con sus prestamos".
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Huexca Santa Cruz and is made up of members Alicia, Maricela and Eliza who are going to buy sheep to breed; Gloria who is going to buy bracelets and gold rings; Rodolfo who is going to buy calves; Secorro who is going to buy milk to use making cheese and cream; Alejandra who is going to buy eggs, milk and soft drinks; Roció who is going to buy fertilizer; María del Socorro who is going to buy corn, meat, tomatoes, onions, chiles to make tlacoyos (similar to tortillas) and sandwiches.

Maricela is 40 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. The two youngest are high school students. She sells sheep and is asking for a loan in order to buy sorghum and corn and corn-feed in order to nourish the sheep. She began her business 8 years ago, encouraged by her husband, beginning with the profit from the sell of sorghum. 

Most people in this community work as livestock farmers, having sheep in the fields. The business is important because it provides income for food, to reinvest, and for parties for the children. She likes to see the sheep grow and she feels proud to see her children helping to nurture the sheep and putting them out to pasture in the afternoon.

Her hopes and dreams are that her business continues growing, and to build a little room as a bedroom for her daughter, and that her youngest children continue studying. 

The members of the group send this message to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “thank them for the loans, for their confidence in us, and say that we will make the payments and we hope that they continue supporting us through our loans.”

loans.use: to buy sorghum and corn and corn-feed in order to nourish the sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 29-year-old businessman who offers cleaning services to residents in Mombasa. He is married and has been operating this business for the past two years and he is doing great in the business. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our staff and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase cleaning machines and washing detergents for his business and use the anticipated profits to build capital. 

He hopes to realize more profits from his business and have a settled future.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning machines and washing detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare land and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 37, and has been in farming for 15 years. His farm currently produces milk, which he sells to Brookside Dairies. He is married and has six children, age 14 to 4 years. Four of these children are already schooling.

John has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. He says the income generated will help him meet his family's basic needs. He adds that his focus is to breed dairy goats and sell to other farmers in the future.

John is glad Juhudi Kilimo provides farmers with loans and reiterates that small-holder farming businesses will be greatly changed with the access to such loans. He notes, however, that drought remains a challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is aged sixty-five and has been in active farming for over twenty years in her home area of Murang'a, Kenya, producing and selling eggs and milk to the local market.  She is a widow with six grown-up children.

Teresa has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and boost her poultry business.  She says the income will help her in maintaining her five orphaned grandchildren.  She adds that the income will also help her improve her dairy farming by buying more dairy cows.

She is however concerned with poor market prices and notes the farmer's limitation of the inaccessibility of external markets.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds for her farm.

loans.name: La Finquita Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Finquita lo conforman Janneth, Dreydy y María Feliz tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Janneth de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de pinolillo en Honduras. Este negocio lo inicio por medio de un familiar quien la incentivo y le dio la idea, ya que es muy apetecido el pinolillo nica.  Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz, cacao, leña…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Dreydy quien vende ropa americana y María Félix tiene una licorería.
texts.en:
The group "La Finquita" is made up of Janneth, Dreydy and Maria Feliz, three hardworking and enterprising women.  Janneth is the coordinator of the group.  She is 42 years old and works selling pinolillo (a traditional Nicaraguan corn and cocoa-based beverage) in Honduras.  She started this business through a relative who motivated her and gave her the idea, since Nicaraguan pinolillo is a very appealing beverage.  Janneth will invest this loan in corn, cocoa, firewood and other supplies.  

The other members of this group are Dreydy, who sells American clothing, and Maria Feliz, who has a liquor store.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including: corn, cocoa, firewood, cinnamon, cloves, a spice grinder, etc.

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous is fifty-four years old, married to Nduku and together they are blessed with four children.  He offers veterinary services to the residents of the Tala area where there is a regular flow of customers as he is the only vet in the region.  He has been in this business for the last eight years and earns an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Stanslous is applying for his first loan of KES 12,000 from KADET Ltd with which he plans to purchase pesticides and insecticides to use in his business.  He will use the extra profit to expand his reach of services.

Stanslous hopes to have a well-stocked business as well as being more reliable to his customers.  He is determined to excel.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and insectcides.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”LOS ANGELES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia;  La socia tiene 41 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la docencia ella es profesora de nivel primaria en uno de los colegios en Ttio,  la socia también alterna sus actividades con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia compra ropa especialmente para damas y las distribuye entre sus amistades y colegas en el colegio, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y desea salir adelante y para ello requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para incrementar sus ganancias y dar mejor calidad de vida  a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor  y vender entre sus amistades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Los Angeles Communal Bank which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. 

She is 41 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She is a primary school teacher in one of the elementary schools in Ttio. She also has a business buying and selling clothes, especially for women, and distributing them to her friends and colleagues in her school. She is a hardworking woman and wants to get ahead. She requires a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to improve her profits and provide a better quality of life for her children.

She will buy clothing wholesale and sell it to her friends. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale to sell to her friends.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a father of three children aged eighteen, ten and three. He has been in farming for over fifteen years, producing and selling tea and milk to the local market in his home area of Murang'a, Central Kenya.  He also runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Peter has requested a loan of KES 63,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the dairy income will help him pay for his children's education.  He adds that he is optimistic with his farming business and sees his businesses grow with the loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

He is also concerned with the fluctuation in milk prices in the local market

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged sixty-two and produces tea, milk and coffee in her home area of Muranga for the local market.  She has forty-five years of experience in farming and is married with eight grown-up children.

Lucy has made a loan request of KES 53,000 to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says the additional dairy income will make her family more secure financially.  She hopes the her milk output will grow to one hundred litres per day.

Lucy appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but she states that recurrent drought is a challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Panian

texts.en:
Panian is forty-three years old and married to Mpaire.  They are blessed with three children who are all in school.  He runs a transport service business in Kajiado town.  He has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 5,000 per month.

Panian is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd with which he plans to add more money from his savings to purchase another motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to pay his children's school fees.

Panian hopes to build a rental house in his plot of land.  He says that he is very hard working.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a resident of Muranga in Central Kenya where she dwells with her two children, ages 20 and 9 years, with the younger one still schooling. Lydia currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and produces coffee, tea and milk which she sells locally.

Lydia has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she believes dairy farming will be her source of income and act as her self-employment. She remains optimistic she will be able to improve her children's living standards. She is however, unhappy with unstable milk prices.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is a very hardworking woman who has been practicing mixed farming for over 5 years. She is 36 years old, married and a mother to three children. 

She is applying for her first loan where she plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs such as maize seeds and fertilizers and use the remainder to add more stock in her grocery business. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers and as well as to add stock in her grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tayson lo conforman  tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Cecilia del Carmen  quien es la coordinadora del grupo propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio con 50 dólares y poco a poco fue aumentándola.  El crédito lo invertirá en productos (granos básicos, carne, productos lácteos…etc.) para mejorar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel de 47 años quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 25 años y Juana Bertilda quien es costurera desde hace 30 años.
texts.en: The Tayson Communal Bank is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people, one of whom is Cecilia del Carmen who is coordinator of the ownership group of a grocery store, which she started with 50 dollars and gradually expanded. She will invest the loan in products (basic grains, meat, dairy products, etc) in order to improve her business. The other members of the communal bank are Maribel, 47, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 25 years and Juana Bertilda, who has been a seamstress for 30 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de vestidos y ternos, la socia trabaja especificamente con la ropa americana, ella desea a futuro muy cercano y esta haceindo todo lo mejor posible para tener su propia tienda de venta de ropa y  su propio local para ella atreverse a traer ropa americana al por mayor. La socia en esta ocasión esta deseando invertir el credito en la compra de ropa al por mayor americana y pagar el trasporte.
texts.en: This member continues her business buying and selling dresses and suits. She works specifically with American clothes. She wishes for the near future to have her own clothes store and she is doing everything possible to do this. With it, she would bring in American clothes wholesale. On this occasion, she wants to invest her loan in buying clothes wholesale and paying for the transportation.

loans.use: to invest the loan in buying American clothes wholesale and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicken, meat, and fresh cassava fish for her business

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en:
Nelius is a resident of Murang'a, Central Kenya, and is married with eight adult children. She is 76 years old and has been in farming for over 50 years.  Her farm produces milk and coffee for the local market.

Nelius has requested a loan of 42,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which will enable her to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the boost to her income will enable her to be self reliant, as well as to take care of one of her children who still lives with her. However, Nelius laments the unstable market prices for milk.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and married to Abel. She runs a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of about 10 years and has a monthly income of about 24,400 Kenyan shillings. 

This is her eighth loan from KADET LTD, after having been introduced to the lending agency by a member of the credit staff. She hopes to increase her business stock with more cereals, which she seems to be running low on. 

She hopes to have a capital base of one million Kenya shillings to supply large scale consumers like schools and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for her retail shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in farming for over 25 years. His farms in Murang'a produce tea for the Kenya Tea Development Authority and coffee for the local market. He says he relies fully on farming for his upkeep. He is married and has two children, ages 8 and 12.

John has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and venture into dairy farming, as well. He says the income from dairy farming will be used to pay for the education of his children. He hopes to expand the farm to four cows in five years. John mentions the high costs of feed as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 48 years old, married, and has three adult children. She lives with her family in Murang'a, Central Kenya, where she has been practicing mixed farming and selling her produce of coffee and tea, among other horticultural products, to the local market.

Janet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy poultry birds and expand her farming business. She is optimistic that the poultry business will grow quickly to a farm of 2,000 birds. She is glad that farming will now be her main source of income. She says the good work of Juhudi Kilimo is uplifting the living standards of her children. 

To Janet, high cost of animal food is a major challenge.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Matayian

texts.en:
Matayian is 33 years old and married to Toiyanet. He has been running a motorcycle transport business for a period of about eight years, with a monthly income of approximately 4,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD after having been introduced to the lending agency by a KADET credit officer.  He plans to use the loan to service his motorbike, repair it, and purchase any parts that need to be replaced. He hopes to start a hotel and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of four children, aged fourteen, thirteen, ten and seven.  She is herself aged thirty-four and has been in farming for ten years.  Her produce of beans, maize, potatoes, cabbages and milk are sold locally.  She also does tailoring for additional income.

Beatrice has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow.  She says she wants to embark on intensive dairy farming and build a bigger and better dairy unit for her animals with a focus of adding three more dairy cows in her farm in within five years.  She says the income will also go into educating her children.

Beatrice also mentions insufficient water supply as her big challenge coupled with high input costs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta diaria de productos nutricionales, la socia vende en forma independiente aún no a podido ampliar su negocio y en esta ocasión desea hacerlo, para ello la socia requiere de comprar productos para implementar su tienda y tambien compra exhibidores para la puesta de los productos.
texts.en: The member continues with her daily business of buying and selling nutritional products.  She sells on an independent basis and still has not been able to expand her business but would like to do so now.  She is requesting a loan to buy products and display cabinets for her store.

loans.use: To buy products and display cabinets for her store.

loans.name: Las Glorias Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Glorias está conformado por tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Gloria Elena quien se dedica a la venta de fresco, gaseosa, leche y helados desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene seis hijos ya mayores quienes la apoyan y ayudan.
Las otras integrantes son Eveling quien vende ropa desde hace 2 años y Sheila vende ropa y productos Avon desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Glorias" is comprised of three hard-working entrepreneurs, one of whom is Mrs. Gloria Elena who has been selling softdrinks, sodas, milk and ice cream for six years.  She has six children who are adults and help and support her.

The other members of the group are Eveling, who has been selling clothing for two years, and Sheila, who has been selling clothing and Avon products for six years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as fruit, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María Carolina tiene 44 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 6 hijos, pero vive con 2 de ellos, de 13 y 5 años. Habita en su casa propia en el centro poblado San Fernando de Kivinaki en la provincia de Chanchamayo (selva central). Ella es una mujer de campo. Le gusta lo que hace. Con la agricultura ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. En sus terrenos de cultivos propios siembra: yucas, plátanos, frijol, maíz y cítricos. Sabe muy bien como comercializar sus productos, ya que cada uno de ellos se cosecha en distintos meses del año. Así se abastece. Y como ella no desperdiga, también se dedica a la venta de hojas de plátanos. “Es rentable vender hojas, cada paquete está a 5 soles y a la quincena vendo de 60 a 70 paquetes”, dice. También compra y vende maní, adquiriendo el kilo a 8 soles, y lo que ofrece de 10 hasta 11 soles. El negocio es conveniente. Con el mismo esfuerzo y perseverancia, María desea ampliar sus sembríos, para producir maní y plátanos, de esa manera sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”, su banco comunal, por que sabe que en equipo los logros serán mayores. De obtener el dinero, contratará personal para la limpieza de sus parcelas de yucas y maíz. Con lo sobrante comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
María Carolina, 44, is a single mother of six children, two of which (ages 13 and 5) live with her.  She has her own home in the center of the town of San Fernando de Kivinaki in the province of Chanchamayo (central forest).  She is a farmer and loves what she does, as it has allowed her to provide for her children.  On her cropland she grows yucca plant, plantain, beans, corn and citrus fruits.  

She is an expert at selling her produce since each harvest occurs in different months of the year, and she stays stocked this way.  And since she does not throw anything away, she also sells plantain leaves.  "Selling the leaves is profitable, since each packet is worth 5 PEN and every two weeks I sell between 60 to 70 packets.", she says.  She also buys and sells peanuts, which she purchases at 8 PEN and sells for 10 or 11 PEN.  The business is easy.  With the same effort and perseverance, María wants to add to her crops and grow peanuts so she can give her children a better quality of life.  

This is her first loan through MFP and she is grateful for the support.  She is happy to belong to the communal bank "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki" because she believes that more achievement comes through teamwork.  The loan will be used to hire workers to clear the yucca and corn fields.  The rest will be used to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya.  He is aged thirty-three, married with two children aged ten and six and has been in farming for six solid years.  His farm produces coffee, kales and bananas which are sold locally.  He also does timber lumbering besides farming.

Ashford has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to KES 30,000 to help him purchase irrigation pipes for his banana plantation.  He says that the irrigation system will not only help in banana farming but will expand his entire farming business which has always been limited by insufficient rainfall.  He adds that the boost in farming income will take care of his basic family needs.

Ashford notes that sourcing for capital, insufficient rainfall and diseases are the major challenges farmers face in Nkubu.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Musee

texts.en:
Musee is fifty-one years old and is married to Jane, who is forty years old.  They are blessed with two children.  He has been running his retail shop for a period of about two years with an income of approximately KES 5,000 a month. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a Kadet member of staff.  He wants to use the loan to add more stock to his retail shop by buying sugar, tea and sweets. 

He hopes to be a wholesaler and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and sweets.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is twenty-seven years old and married and with three children.  He has a farm where he keeps livestock and poultry for meat, milk and eggs.  He has been in this business for a period of about three years with an income of approximately KES 9,000 a month.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to KADET by a KADET credit officer.  He wants to use the loan to add more chicks and goats to his farm, which he will rear to a bigger and better size and then resell. 

He hopes to be the leading poultry supplier in his area and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and goats.

loans.name: Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCIO DEL AMANECER” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicio, trabajo en minerales, producción, comercio. 

La señora Maria Luisa indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de una promotora que llego a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trabajo en minerales (orfebrería) que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su padre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de minerales) que adquirirá de los centros mineros y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sus servicios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROCIO DEL AMANECER" is beginning its second cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Centro Villa Exaltación.  It is comprised of eight members and chaired by Mrs. Maria Luisa, who is the president.  The different businesses of the members include: services, minerals-related work, production, and commerce.

Maria Luisa says this is her second cycle as a member of Pro Mujer and she joined through an invitation from a representative who visited her home.  Her current business is working with minerals (jewelry making), which she learned from her father.  She has been in business for several years.

The loan she is requesting is to expand her business (buying minerals) through mining centers.  She then will make and sell her products based on orders.  This source of income allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can.  She is a widow and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the services it provides.

loans.use: To buy minerals.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; Continua con su negocio de adnimistrar y atender la tienda de abarrotes que la socia tiene, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros productos y en esta oportunidad la socia desea implementar la tienda y comprar panetones vino, champan para las fiestas navideñas y respondiendo al pedido de sus clientes; La socia solicita el prestamo para invertire en la compra de  oanetones, vinos, champan y los productos frecuentes para atender las necesidades de los clientes, la socia desea seguir creciendo y ampliar su tienda ya tal vez poner un poco de materiales de libreria y combinar sus tienda y sus servicios.
texts.en: Mrs. Marcelina continues managing business and running her grocery store, where she sells essential goods such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta, and oil, among other items.  On this occasion she would like to stock her store with panettone, wine and champagne for the Christmas holidays in response to customer orders.  In addition to these items, she will use the loan to buy popular products to attend to customer needs.  She wants to continue growing and expand her store,  perhaps adding stationery items as well as services.

loans.use: To buy panettone, wine, champagne and other popular items.

loans.name: Visión Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Visión hacia el Futuro está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Lisbeth quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes de manera ambulante. Ella está casada con don Melvin quien es contratista y con el cual tiene 2 hijos.
Las otras integrantes son Bety Sofía  tiene un pequeño preescolar e invertirá en diplomas y algunas mejoras al preescolar y Carol se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Visión hacia el Futuro [Vision Towards the Future] group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Lisbeth, who sells clothes and toys as a street vendor. She is married to Melvin, who is a contractor and with whom she has 2 children.

The other members are Bety Sofía, who has a small pre-school and who will invest in school certificates and some improvements to the school, and Carol, who sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as clothes and toys.

loans.name: Ma. De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Ma. de Jesús  es soltara y vive en una localidad muy bonita ella es soltera y vive son una hermana.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  y venta de pollos en donde lleva trabajando  tres años  y dos meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a mejorado muchos su ingresos  para su hogar.
  
   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que  también  quiere tener sus propios ingresos para apoyarse con algunos gastos que se generan  en la compra de sus alimentos.
    
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando para  tenr sus ingresos necesarios para su familia con la que vive.
texts.en:
Ma. de Jesús is single and lives in a very pretty community. She lives with a sister. 

She asked for the loan to invest in buying and selling chickens. She has been doing this for three years and two months and she remarks that it is going well for her since it has really improved the income for her home.  
  
Her inspiration for this activity started because she wanted her own income to pay for some expenses for food. 
    
What she wants the most with this small activity is to keep working to have the income she needs for her family, with whom she lives.

loans.use: to fund buying and selling chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
La señora Enedina  vive en un barrio muy pequeño ella es casada con el señor  Francisco Gabriel y con quién procreo cinco hijos quienes cuatro a un están a su responsabilidad.

Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas, en donde lleva trabando  siete meses en la que comenta que le va  bien ya que con ello a mejorado mucho sus ingresos para su familia.

 Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los  ingresos de la casa  y apoyara su hijo con sus estudios.
 Lo más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad logre mejorar cada día sus ingresos para así agrandar su negocio y siga trabajando con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Enedina lives in a very small neighbourhood. She is married to Francisco Gabriel and they have five children together, of which she still supports four.

She is asking for a loan to invest by buying ingredients to make food. She has been working in this trade for seven months and comments that it is going well as she has already greatly improved her family income.

She was inspired to start work in this trade because she wanted to help her husband with the household income and support her son with his studies. She is hopeful that with this little job she will manage to improve their income everyday in order to grow her business and continue working with the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza de 25 años convive con Rubén, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años. Elisa y su familia viven en la casa de sus padres en el anexo de Kivinaki, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Eliza ha visto en la agricultura su forma de ganarse la vida y el sustento de su familia.
Es por eso que cuenta con 4 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, donde siembra café y naranjas. El café lo tendrá listo para los meses de abril y mayo, mientras que las naranjas ya las está cosechando en los meses de noviembre y diciembre. La venta de estos cítricos le trae buenos ingresos.
Por su parte su pareja, se dedica al trabajo de campo para otras personas y al día obtiene de 20 a 60 soles por los diversos servicios que realiza. Asimismo la apoya en la jornada del campo, además de otros operarios a quienes contrata. El trabajo es cansado, arriesgado, dedicado pero a la vez gratificante.
Con el pasar del tiempo, espera construir su propio hogar y equiparlo para así vivir más cómodamente. Es una de sus primeras metas. Sería éste su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP. Por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”. Con el dinero podrá comprar 3 bolsas de abonos cuyo precio oscila entre 110 y 120 soles, para 2 parcelas de café. Asimismo contratará operarios para que lo ayuden en la fertilización.
texts.en:
Eliza is 25 years old and lives with Rubén, with whom she has two children aged 8 and 6. Elisa and her family live in her parent's house in the small village of Kivinaki, Perené district in the province of Chanchamayo.

Eliza sees agriculture as her way of earning a living and supporting her family.

For this reason she has 4 plots of cultivated land where she sows coffee and oranges. The coffee will be ready for the months of May and April, while she harvests the oranges in the months of November and December. The sale of these citrus fruits brings in a good income.

Rubén works in the field with other people. He earns 20-60 PEN a day for the various jobs he carries out. In the working day in the field, he counts on his partners support as well as the other workers that they hire. The work is tiring, dangerous, time consuming, but satisfying.

As time passes, she hopes to build her own home and furnish it so they can live more comfortably. This is one of her first goals.

This is her first loan, obtained thanks to the help of MFP. For this she is committed to being punctual with her payments. She is happy to belong to the Communal Bank "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki". With the money she will be able to buy 3 bags of manure, the price of which varies between 110 and 120 PEN, for the 2 coffee plots. She will also hire day laborers to help her with the fertilization of the coffee plots.

loans.use: to buy two bags of organic manure and hire day laborers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 36 años de edad y vive en El Cielito, una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Santa Barbara. Ella tiene 3 años de estar con su pareja Fredy. Vilma tiene tres hijos – un bebe de 15 meses, una hija de 20 y un hijo de 17 años de edad, lo cual está estudiando. 

Vilma especializa en la siembra y producción de café. Posee dos manzanas de tierra donde produce café pergamino húmedo. Ella tiene 15 años de ser caficultora. Vilma empezó a sembrar con esfuerzos propios con el objetivo de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor educación. 

Solicitó este crédito de L16,000 para pagar la recolección de la cosecha y para invertir en fertilizante y la siembra de vivero de café.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is 36 years old and lives in El Cielito, a neighborhood in the municipality of Santa Barbara. She has been with her partner Fredy for three years. She has three children: a 15-month-old baby, a 20-year-old daughter, and a 17-year-old son who is in school.

Vilma specializes in growing and producing coffee. She has two plots of land on which she produces Pergamino coffee. Vilma has been a coffee grower for 15 years. She began planting crops through her own efforts so that she could help her family move forward and provide her children with a better education.

Vilma is requesting a loan of 16,000 HNL to pay for the gathering of her harvest and to invest in fertilizers and a coffee nursery.

loans.use: to pay for the gathering of her harvest and to invest in fertilizers and a coffee nursery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and toys to sell at Christmas time.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  María de Lourdes es madre soltera con un hijo  a su responsabilidad y vive con sus padres.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la copra de  ropas, para damas, caballero, niñas y niños, en donde  lleva trabajando cuatro meses  y comenta que le está dando un buen resultado en sus ingresos y ganancias.

    Para dedicarse a esta actividad lo niño su familia ya que su esposo la abandono con sus bebe y decidió trabajar con algo para sostenerse y a su hijo no le haga falta lo más necesario y logre salir adelante.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella vaya incrementando día con día sus ingresos  y con el tiempo su negocio  a aumente mas.
texts.en:
María de Lourdes is a single mother, and she is responsible for one child.  She lives with her parents.

She requested the loan to buy clothing for women, men, and children.  She has been working this way for four months.  She says that it is giving her good results in her income and profits.

In order to do this work her family helps with her son because her husband abandoned her and her baby.  She decided to work in order to support her son so that he would have the basic necessities and so that she would get ahead.

She wishes that her small business activity and her income will grow day to day.  In time, she wishes that her business will grow even more.

loans.use: to pay for buying and selling clothes.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou habite un village situé à 15 km de la ville principale. Il est marié et père de famille. Il est chauffeur : métier qu’il exerce depuis plus de deux ans.IL faut noter qu’il est très assidu dans son travail car sa journée démarre à 08h du matin et se termine à 23h.
Avec le crédit il veut acheter un moteur pour son véhicule Renauld. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa petite famille.
Avec les bénéfices  il pense augmenter son parc automobile.
texts.en: Amadou lives in a village located 15 kilometers away from the main city.  He is married and has a family.  He has been working as a driver for over two years.  Amadou is a very hard worker:  his working day starts at 8AM and ends at 11PM.  With his loan he would like to buy an engine for his Renault vehicle.  He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses.  With the profits, he is thinking of purchasing additional vehicles.

loans.use: To buy a Renault engine.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry se conformó en abril del 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el 8 ciclo, ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar a sus familias.
La Sra. Gullermina, comenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras, esto gracias a la huerta que monto gracias a un crédito anterior que le dio la fundación, además de eso también vende huevos.  Nos comenta que mediante los créditos pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más hortalizas y huevos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank was formed with a lot of effort in April of 2008.  They are now in their eighth cycle.  They work together in a supportive way within the program for enterprising women of the Fundación.  In addition to each one’s independent work, they also develop business activities as a group.  They mutually help each other to reach their objectives, which is to work in order to support their families.

Gullermina tells us that she sells vegetables thanks to the garden she set up.  She did this thanks to a previous loan that the Fundación gave her.  In addition to this, she also sells eggs.  She tells us that through the loans she was able to improve her business activity, her standard of living, and her income.

She is requesting the loan to buy more vegetables and eggs.  This way she will be able to stock up and meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy eggs and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Godinez Group

texts.es:
La señora Asucena es casada. tiene, 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de canastillas de plásticos de diferentes diseños y tamaños, inició este negocio con un poco de capital y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales consistente en cintas de plástico, y producir mas canastas,es el futuro desea ver su negocio convertido en una fabrica de canastas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio, la artesanía y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Asucena is married, 59 years of age, and never had an opportunity to study. She has 6 children, 3 of whom are studying. Asucena is an artisan who makes plastic baskets of different designs and sizes. She began this business with little capital and up to the present, she has 6 years of experience.

Asucena is requesting a loan to purchase ribbons of plastic to be used in producing more baskets. Her future desire is to see her business converted into a basket factory. The remaining members of the group are involved in commerce, artisan crafts, and raising domestic animals.

loans.use: buy materials for making baskets to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El  joven Marco Antonio  vive en un bario pequeño en donde las personas  celebran la fiesta san francisco de asís.
Él solito el préstamo para invertir en la copra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  barretas en donde lleva trabajando dos meses en la que comenta que  le está dando un buen resultado para sus ingresos.

 Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que también quieres apoyara sus padres con los ingresos de la casi así también a hora para comenzar  su estudios

 Lo que él desea es segur estudiando para si terminar una carrera la cual pueda  desempeñar para  así seguir adelante y apoyar a sus padres con la economía.
texts.en:
The young Marco Antonio lives in a small barrio where the residents celebrate the feast of San Francisco de Asis.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools and materials for making metal bars and rods. He has been doing this for 2 months and he reports that good income is resulting from the business.

Marco Antonio is inspired to pursue his business because he wants to help his parents with their income, and also, he wishes to begin his studies again. What he wants most is to continue studying to complete his career, and to get out of debt, forge ahead, and help his parents economically.

loans.use: to pay for tools for his blacksmith's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and bags of coal for sale in her business.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Claudia del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 27 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años.  Ella inicio este negocio con unos ahorros luego con los préstamos ha ido aumentando.
Claudia inicio en Adim con crédito grupal y ahora se ha graduado a crédito individual, con el cual piensa comprar mercadería por lo que era necesario.
texts.en:
Claudia del Carmen, 27 years old, is a working woman and entrepreneur and has been selling clothes for the last 3 years. She began this business with some savings and later expanded it through loans.

Claudia started as a member of an Adim communal bank group and now she has advanced to an individual loan, with which she will buy necessary merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Yeneida

texts.es:
Yeneida cuenta con 34 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos los cuales estudian la mayor se llama linda está cursando 2º grado de preparatoria, Cristina Estrella está cursando 2º de secundaria, Litzi está en 1º de primaria, Jacqueline solo tiene 2 años de edad y tiene un bebe de 9 meses se llama Mayco.

Ella es empleada pero también es comerciante vende bolsas de mano de muchos modelos juveniles, para hombres, señoras su hija linda le ayuda a vender las bolsas con sus compañeras de la escuela le ayuda mucho, yeneida invertirá su préstamo en la compra de mas bolsas de nuevos modelos ya que le ayuda mucho porque sus ganancias es para ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela y va surtiendo su negocio ella espera que le vaya muy bien en su negocio espera este año incrementarlo mucho mas meter mas mercancía para tener más surtido da las gracias a frac por la ayuda otorgada.
texts.en:
Yeneida is 34 years old. She is a single mother with five children, and the older children are students. The oldest is called Linda and she is a sophomore in high school. Cristina Estrella is in the second year of middle school, and Litzi is in the first year of primary school. Jacqueline is two years old and Yeneida also has a nine month old named Mayco.

She is employed but also she sells many types of bags for youth, for men, and ladies. Her daughter Linda helps her by selling bags to her classmates. Yeneida will use the money from the loan to buy more bags of the latest styles which will help her a lot because her earnings pay for the school fees for her children, and she is going to stock her business. She hopes that her business will do well this year, and wants to expand it, and introduce more merchandise in order to have more assortment, and she gives thanks to FRAC (Fundacion Realidad) for the help they have given.

loans.use: to buy bags, purses for women and backpacks for men

loans.name: Ross

texts.es:
Rossde 33 años convive hace 13 años con Juan Carlos con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el anexo de Kivinaki, distrito de perené, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Ross es una mujer de negocios. Desde que unió su vida con Juan Carlos abrió una tienda en su hogar. Empezó vendiendo artículos de perfumería, gaseosas y comestibles. Actualmente su pequeña tienda es una botica, ahí vende medicinas de  todas las marcas, artículos de perfumería, juguetes, ropa, gaseosas, etc.
Le va muy bien en el negocio por surtir bien sus productos, pues en todos estos años ha vista las necesidades de sus compradores, las que satisfació de alguna manera. Se siente contenta con su negocio.
“Hace medio año me robaron en la tienda, como 2000 soles, en todo este tiempo tuve que trabajar para volver a invertir en mi negocio. Mi situación volvió a la normalidad gracias a mis ahorros, ahora a seguir invirtiendo”, comenta. Ella anhela contar con un terreno en la ciudad de La Merced, por las mayores oportunidades de educación para su hijo. Así que seguirá trabajando duro y parejo. Este sería su primer crédito de MFP, por lo que siente contenta de recibir su apoyo. A la vez muestra satisfacción de pertenecer al banco comunal “las Semillitas de Kivinaki”. Comprará con el dinero insumos para implementar su negocio, con gaseosas, ropa, juguetes, perfumería, todo esto para la campaña navideña que es muy conveniente.
texts.en: Ross is 33 years old and has been married for 13 years to Juan Carlos, with whom she has a 4-year-old son. They live in their own home in Kivinaki, district of Perené, province of Chanchamayo, Peru. She is a businesswomen who opened a store at home after she wed Juan Carlos. She started out selling perfumes, soft drinks and food. Now her little shop is a boutique, selling all kinds of brands of medicine, perfumes, toys, clothing, soft drinks and other items. The business is going very well and is well stocked since in all this time she has met the needs of her suppliers in one way or another. She feels content with the business. "Six months ago I was robbed in the store, like 2,000 soles (approximately $750), and over all this time I have had to work to re-invest in my business. My situation has returned to normal thanks to my savings, and now I'm going to continue investing," she said. Ross aims to have a plot of land in the city of La Merced, where there are better educational opportunities for her son. So she will continue working long and hard. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels content in receiving your support. At the same time, she feels satisfied with her community bank, "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki." She plans to use the money to purchase supplies, such as soft drinks, clothing, toys and perfume, to expand her business for Christmas, which is fast approaching.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, toys, clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Vestiline Group

texts.en:
Shukuru is in his late thirties and is married with one child.  He has been running a food vendor business for six years now.  He works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shukuru’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   He used the previous loans to open a small retail shop for his wife, selling things like sweets, biscuits, ground nuts, juice, and water. He increased the food stock, so can now sell more food and has paid back all his loans successfully. 

He hopes for a loan to increase the food stock.  Shukuru’s dream is to one day be able to buy a motorcycle.

Shukuru will share this loan with his loan group, Vestiline, which has a total of sixteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans.

loans.use: to increase the food stock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa cuenta con 32 años de edad, es casada su esposo se llama Exsaen es empleado, ella ahora esta embarazada tiene 5 meses.
 Ella es educadora de primaria y quisiera iniciar un negocio de venta de bolsas para damas, mochilas para caballero, juveniles, ella piensa comprar los productos en el lugar donde trabaja su esposo, ellos creen que este es un buen negocio y espera que todo vaya como ellos esperan, pues éste será su primer negocio y ya piensa en el como algo muy grande. 
Teresa le da las gracias a todas las personas que hacen posible este tipo de programas.
texts.en: Teresa is 32 years old and married to Exsaen, who also works. Teresa is currently five-months pregnant. She is an elementary school teacher and would like to start a business selling women's handbags and backpacks for men and young people. She plans to buy the products at the place where her husband works. She believes this is a good business and hopes everything goes as planned. This will be her first business and she is already thinking bigger. Teresa gives thanks to everyone who has made this type of program possible.

loans.use: to purchase handbags and backpacks for women, men and young people.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es: María Eufemia cuenta con 72 años de edad es madre soltera ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras ella apenas inicio su negocio no tiene  mucho pero dice que sacara adelante su negocio ya que es una ayuda para ella, dice que el préstamo fue de gran ayuda ya que lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como son: aguacate, calabaza, jitomate, manzana, romanita, etc. a doña María le gustaría que su negocio incrementara mas ya que ahora no tiene muy bien surtido pero su meta es incrementar el negocio y sacarlo adelante esta muy agradecida con su préstamo.
texts.en: María Eufemia is 72 years old and a single mother. She is a merchant selling fruits and vegetables. She just started the business and does not have much, but says that she will keep moving forward because the business helps her. She says the loan is a big help because she will invest in the purchase of produce like avocados, pumpkins, tomatoes, apples, romaine lettuce, etc. María would like to expand her business even more because right now it isn't well stocked, but her goal is grow and keep making headway. She is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Herbalife Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HERBALIFE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Verónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos de belleza Herbalife, venta de comida

La señora Verónica,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas y vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, (Herbalife) que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de productos Herbalife) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo implementara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Herbalife” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Verónica. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling Herbalife beauty products and selling food.

Sra. Verónica says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by her friends and neighbors. Verónica currently has a business selling Herbalife beauty products, which she has been doing for some time.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying Herbalife products, which she will acquire in bulk in La Ceja. They will be used later on to fulfill her orders. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Verónica is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Verónica said that she enjoys the loan training and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro cuenta con 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos Clara de 7 año de edad que esta cursando primero de primaria y Evelyn de 4 años que esta en el preescolar, su esposo se llama miguel ángel es empleado.

Ella iniciara su negocio va vender producto de la temporada de diciembre ella tenia la venta de pescados pero por problemas de salud lo dejo y ahora surtirá todo para las ocasiones navideñas, socorro espera que le vaya muy bien en el negocio ya que le esta poniendo todo el empeño y las ganas para sacar el negocio adelante también le gustaría que su negocio poco a poco incremente.
texts.en:
Socorro is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Clara is seven years old and starting her first year of elementary school. Evelyn is four years old and in preschool. Her husband is named Miguel Ángel and is employed.

Socorro started a business selling products for the December season. She had a business selling fish, but had to quit due to health problems. Now she wants to be completely stocked for the Christmas festivities. Socorro hopes to do very well in her business because she has put forth all of her effort and earnings into this venture so that it can succeed. She would also like for her business to increase a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy ornaments, lights, streamers, tinsel, and other items.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa cuenta con 63 años, es casada su esposo se llama Eusebio es albañil ella tiene 4 nietos. Nicolasa cuida a tres de ellos: la mayor se llama Cristal esta estudiando 4° grado de primaria, Clara en 1° de primaria, y Juan Carlos al preescolar.

Ella es comerciante tiene la venta de alhajas de oro y cuenta también con una granja de pollos y borregos, ya tiene 10 años con el negocio lo cual dice que invertirá su préstamo en comprar algunas alhajas ya ahora esta muy caro ella espera que su préstamo le ayude mas ya que le gustaría que su negocio progresara aun mas esta muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 63 years old and married.  Her husband Eusebio is a bricklayer.  She has four grandchildren under her care, and takes care of three of them. The oldest is named Cristal and is in the fourth grade, Clara is in the first grade, and Juan Carlos is in preschool.  

Nicolasa is a merchant who sells gold jewelry and also manages a farm with chickens and sheep.  She already has 10 years of experience and says that she will invest her loan in the purchase of some jewelry which is now very expensive.  Nicolasa expects that the loan will help her because she would like to make progress in her business.  She is extremely grateful for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase precious gems, earrings, and other jewelry pieces.

loans.name: Magda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Magda del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio ropa usada, cosméticos y productos químicos. Ella inicio en Adim en crédito solidario actualmente se graduó a crédito individual el cual piensa invertir en productos especialmente ropa.
texts.en: Sra. Magda del Socorro is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur who sells used clothing, cosmetics, and chemical products.  She started with ADIM by participating in a solidarity loan, but now she has graduated to an individual loan.  Magda plans to invest in products, especially clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena cuenta 64 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ella pero ninguno ya está estudiando su esposo se llama Emigdio es campesino.
Ella es comerciante ya tiene 4 años con su negocio de ropa doña Elena invertirá su préstamo en la compra de ropa de nuevos modelos de blusas, ella sale a vender a las colonias más cercanas y dice que le está yendo muy bien a doña Elena le gustaría establecer un local para allí vender su ropa por ahora solo está vendiendo fuera en los lugares más cercanos pero no descarta la oportunidad y cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elena is 64 years old, married, and has three children who are dependent on her. None of them are in school. Her husband Emigdio is a farm laborer.

Doña Elena is a merchant and has been selling clothes for four years. She will invest her loan in the purchase of new styles of blouses. Elena travels to the neighborhoods nearby to sell her goods and says that she has done very well. She would like to establish a shop where she can sell clothes, but for now she must go sell in the places that are closest to her. However, she does not rule out the opportunity of reaching her goal.

loans.use: to buy blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fashion slippers and shoes for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma de 38 años de edad, hace 19 años unió su vida con Miguel, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años. Esta feliz familia vive en una casa propia en el centro poblado de Kivinaki, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Kivinaki es un lugar propicio para el desarrollo de frutos como: naranjas y tangello, productos a los que dedica mucho de su tiempo para su producción. Del mismo modo, pero en menor cantidad cultiva paltas y plátanos.
Con esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos, quienes también la apoyan en las labores del campo.
Los cuidados para sus sembríos son constantes, por eso debe recurrir a personal para que trabajen sus tierras.  
Por su parte Miguel, su esposo, trabaja como albañil en distintas construcciones. Así añaden más ingresos a su canasta familiar.  Y como Vilma no es conformista, distribuye muy bien su tiempo para desempeñarse como profesora  de educación inicial en un jardín de niños en la comunidad de Yaroni. “Me gusta sentirme ocupada. Con lo que hago me siento bien. De manera decente puedo brindarle a mi familia lo necesario para vivir”, comenta orgullosa. Más adelante, piensa adecuar habitaciones a su casa, por que ha visto un negocio rentable en el alquiler de cuartos. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por lo que agradece de antemano el apoyo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a “Las Semillitas de Kivinaki”, su banco comunal, por que sabe que en equipo los resultados serán mayores. De obtener el dinero, podrá pagar la mano de obra para el cultivo de sus naranjas y plátanos. Si el trabajo es intenso destinará entre 250 y 300 soles a 10 operarios por día.
texts.en: Vilma is 38 years old. She married husband Miguel 19 years ago, and together they have two children, ages 18 and 15. This happy family lives in their own home in the center of Kivinaki, province of Chanchamayo, Peru. Kivinaki is a place for growing fruit, such as oranges and tangelos, produce to which Vilma dedicates a lot of her time. She also grows avocados and bananas on a smaller scale. With this job she was able to educate her children, who also help her in the field. Care for her crops is constant, so she has to rely on workers to tend to her land. Her husband is a construction worker, so they both add to the family finances. And since Vilma is a nonconformist, she also spends time working as a kindergarten teacher in the community of Yaroni. "I like to feel busy," she says proudly. "What I do makes me feels good. I can provide my family what it needs to live in a decent way." In the future she would like to set up rooms in her home because she sees a lucrative business in renting out rooms. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she welcomes the support in advance. She feels content to belong to the "Las Semillitas de Kivinaki" community bank because she knows working together will produce better results. With the loan, she plans to hire workers for her orange and banana crops. If the work is intense she plans to allocate between 250 and 300 soles (approximately $90-$110) for 10 workers a day.

loans.use: to hire 10 workers to grow oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sara, quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas aceptaron gustosas y de allí surgió el grupo. Ellas están trabajando en forma conjunta, ayudándose para poder salir adelante.
La sra. Cynthia, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y lencería. Esta acompañada  hace 8 años con el señor Diego quien se dedica a la Herrería, tienen dos hijas menores que van a la primaria. Ella comenta que su negocio de bebidas va muy bien, por que siempre tiene muchos clientes, es por ello que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en el.
Solicita crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser vinos, cervezas, energizantes y demás, para poder abastecerse. Ella sueña con habilitar un negocio propio en su casa donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de comidas y bebidas, logrando así aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The contact for starting this communal bank was Sara. She invited and organized her friends to become part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras (Enterprising Women) program. They were happy to do so, and the group came about from that. They are working jointly, helping one another move forward.

Cynthia is one of the members. She sells drinks and lingerie. She has been together with Diego for eight years. He is an ironworker. They have two daughters who are minors, and go to primary school. 

She says that her drinks business is going very well, because she always has a lot of customers. This is why she likes to continue investing in it. She is applying for a loan in order to stock up on all kinds of drinks, such as wine, energy drinks, and others. 

She dreams about setting up her own business in her home, where she can offer her clients a good variety of meals and drinks, and so manage to increase her income, and provide the best for her family.

loans.use: To buy drinks for later sale.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia continua con le negocio de compra y venta de papa al por mayor y menor en uno de los mercados, la socia tiene su stand y desea comprar papa al por mayor en diferentes variedades, la socia también comprara bolsas de rafia para almecenar las papas según el tipo de papas. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de papa en diferentes variedades, la socia tambien comprara bolsas de rafia.
texts.en:
The borrower is Gregoria. She is continuing with her business of buying and selling potatoes at wholesale and retail at one of the markets. She has a stand, and wishes to buy various varieties of potatoes at wholesale. 

On this occasion, the borrower wishes to use the loan to buy various varieties of potatoes. She also wishes to buy raffia (palm fiber) bags.

loans.use: To buy raffia (palm fiber) bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bajaji.

loans.name: Arturo Andres

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es un hombre de 31 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en la ciudad de Ica, reconocida actualmente en el país como una de las principales ciudades en las que se pueden realizar inversiones, esto se ha logrado gracias al ingreso de nuevos centros comerciales de distintas partes del país, a su vez estas grandes empresas han permitido que muchas más personas tengan oportunidades de empleo, así mismo también se ha beneficiado a comerciantes ajenos a estos grandes centros comerciales, entre uno de esos casos se encuentra la historia del señor Arturo, que gracias al incremento de la afluencia de público y la gran necesidad que tienen de transportarse le han permitido tener mayores ingresos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Arturo hubiese deseado ser Ingeniero, pero debido a la falta de ingresos económicos considera a su trabajo como una gran fuente debido a que sabe que debe trabajar el mayor número de horas posibles para obtener un buen resultado en sus ingresos. Él trabaja como chofer de una moto taxi durante 8 horas diariamente, atendiendo aproximadamente 40 clientes, esto le permite ganar un promedio de S/.70 diarios y si es un buen día gana aproximadamente S/.90, en la ciudad de Ica el costo de transporte en este vehículo equivale a un promedio de S/.1.00 ó S/.1.50 por viaje, dependiendo de la distancia que deba recorrer.

Arturo piensa que su negocio tiene éxito porque le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo. Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, el esfuerzo de Alberto valdrá mucho más debido a que lo que él desea poder darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi para que ya no tenga problemas en algunos viajes que realiza. Su sueño es poder tener otro negocio y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Arturo is a man of 24, and works providing public transport in the city of Ica.  Ica is currently acknowledged to be one of the main cities in the country to invest in. This has been achieved thanks to the influx of new shopping centers from different parts of the country. In turn, these large companies have allowed many more people to have job opportunities. 

In the same way, this has benefitted other business people besides the owners of these large shopping centers. This is the case with Arturo.  Thanks to the increasing affluence of the public and their great need to get around, and thanks to his effort and dedication, he has been able to increase his income. 

Arturo would have liked to be an engineer, if it weren't for his lack of income. He considers his work a great source of income because he knows he must work the greatest number of hours possible to earn a good income.

He drives a mototaxi for eight hours a day, serving approximately 40 customers. This allows him to earn an average of 70 soles a day; around 90 if it's a good day. In the city of Ica, the cost of transport in this vehicle amounts to an average of 1 or 1.5 soles per trip, depending on the distance he has to travel.

Arturo thinks that his business is successful because of the determination he puts into his work. With the help of the Kiva lenders, Arturo's effort will be worth a lot more. This is because he wants to do maintenance work on his mototaxi, so as not to have problems on any of the trips he makes. 

His dream is to be able to have another business, and to build his own house.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Jorge Fructuoso

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Jorge Fructuoso;  Continua con su negocio con su taller de carpintería metalica, el socio continua con sus diferentes trabjaos de carpinteria metalica como puertas, portones, escaleras, ventanas, rejas entre otros mas, el socio a estado ampliando su negocio y aún le falta inversión para comletar la ampliación, motivo por el cual en esta ocasión el socio desea el credito para invertir en la compra de materiales y en la ampliación de sus local.
texts.en: The member is one Jorge Fructuoso. He continues with his business, which is a metalworks workshop. He continues with different metalworking jobs such as doors, entryways, stairs, windows, and grilles among others. The member has been expanding his business and he still needs an investment to complete the expansion. This is his motive for seeking a loan to invest in buying materials and expanding his shop.

loans.use: to invest in materials and in the expansion of his shop.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines; ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos de comida como pollo al horno, estofado de carne y sopas, la socia también se dedica al trabajo de lavar ropa en diferentes casas y el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida y mejorar en el trabajo de lavar ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras al por mayor.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de artesanía, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Señor de Puquin" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ines is 54. She lives with her partner, and has five children. She has a business selling meals. She prepares various food dishes, such as baked chicken, meat stew and soups. She also washes clothes in various homes.  She carries on her food business as a street vendor. 

Through these businesses, she is raising her children. She wants to expand and improve her food stand, and improve her work washing clothes.

She is applying for the loan to buy cooking ingredients, such as chicken, meat and vegetables at wholesale. The other members work at various activities, such as handicrafts, selling weavings, a restaurant, serving meals, and selling beauty products.

The member is thankful to those who are helping her achieve this dream, and promises to pay her instalments within the established time period.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz cuenta con 53 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija que se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria esta cursando 3° grado, su esposo se llama Rafael es campesino. Ella es comerciante tiene una tienda de abarrotes ya tiene 8 años con su negocio poco a ido creciendo e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los siguientes productos: veladoras, aceites, refrescos, papel higiénico, huevo, agua, etc. Doña Beatriz espera que le ayude en lo que se pueda pues ya que quiere increméntalo más.
texts.en: Beatriz is 53, married, and has one daughter who is in the third grade of high school. Beatriz's husband, Rafael, is a farmer. Beatriz has had a grocery store for eight years, and it has been growing. She will invest her loan in the purchase of the following products: candles, oil, pop, toilet paper, eggs, water, etc. Beatriz hopes that you will help her in whatever way you can, since she wants to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy pop, juice, oil, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel de 50 años, es una mujer felizmente casada con Guillermo, con quien tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes. Raquel y Guillermo viven en una casa propia en el centro poblado de San Fernando de Kivinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva Central).
